UD-Mt60YujlRfRknJApgTQ.text: For a Hotel Restaurant we found it a bit pricey, but I guess it is Las Vegas.  However given the mediocre sushi experience, lackluster service and unbelievable mark up on our old standby, Kim Crawford, we can't justify a higher rating.  All those who gave it 4+ stars need to find me for better recommendations.

n5vnWJaf4JtKXdLneKDJAA.text: My fiance and I had dinner at Morimoto a 2 weeks ago and everything was amazing. The hostess greeted us as soon as we stepped up to the entrance. She walked us to our table through the beautiful bar/lounge and past the sushi bar. We were sat at a table in the main dining room, she let us know our servers name, handed us our menus, and went back to the front. Our server was Aries for the night and he was absolutely amazing. We had questions about sake, he listened to what we liked departed and came back with 3 recommendations. We still didn't know what to choose so he chose for us and it was delicious. We started our meal off with beef carpaccio, spicy tuna tacos, foie gras topped oysters, and fried shrimp. Everything was absolutely delicious. Best carpaccio we have had in the city. The tacos are "spicy" it's all flavor and not too spicy. The oysters melt in your mouth, and the fried shrimp was big enough to be an entree. Manager Jeff came by the table a few times throughout the course of us trying almost every appetizer on the menu. Jeff was very social and asked out feedback on the dishes as well as what brought us out for dinner. After filling up quickly on appetizers we decided to go directly to dessert. We ordered the chocolate dish that is served by pouring fire on top of a sphere that reveals the inside as well as the cheesecake. Both desserts were out of this world. All around an amazing expletive from the hostess, to Aries our server, and manager Jeff. The food was great and the service was even better. This is a must when visiting the MGM.

OnjmnRxBdb0CvPYN2rg1Lw.text: Excellent service and delicious food! MGM restaurants are THE BEST and I have to say that this one's my favorite. Fish is so fresh and each dish is so well prepared and tasty overall. I can't wait to be back!

4t_nPxNGO-RevtVY2qGaPA.text: We are progressive eating/drinking through the MGM and started here with a crab roll and drinks.  Crab roll was a very nice.  However, the best part of this restaurant  is the impeccable service!  Djuro and his team were clearly service minded!   Next stop Craft Steak for dinner.  Stay tuned!

rTs8gwvfcM78G3743umjOg.text: We will definitely be coming back here. The food and service was so good! We ordered the hamachi tacos and beef carpaccio for appetizers. Then the duck duck goose and surf and turf for entrees and the fiery tart for dessert. Everything tasted great. Definitely recommend if you haven't been here. We will probably try the Napa location next!

twaDvlLOLxgGGmcinAXmsg.text: Our server Lisa W. was very enjoyable, professional, and courteous. We enjoyed all of our dishes especially the tuna tartare appetizer and the beef tartare appetizer. The sake recommendations from Randi were excellent and we really appreciate the attention to detail. The chocolate dessert recommendation was also to die for. We will definitely go back and recommended everyone to seek out Lisa as their server. We celebrated our 15th wedding anniversary there and it was the best choice in the Vegas area.

8YROtfu_nDbEr0ZVYIWAnA.text: Food: We ordered the sushi and sashimi entree's, all of the appetizer, and entree selections that we ordered were Phenomenal! The Wasabi had some texture to it which means it must have been grated from fresh wasabi root. The deserts definitely had the wow factor, the fiery chocolate tart was burned in front of the diners, reminiscent of Smores around the campfire, instead of firewood the waiters at Morimoto melted the chocolate with Rum.   Ambiance: The decor shows pictures places in japan and a statue of a smiling morimoto made of kimono cloth. Clean and well maintained.  Service: Service was excellent, the attention to detail as well explanations of the food being served and how to eat it were clear.   Overall: It's a great place for dates, and great for a foodie adventure it is a bit pricey but you end the meal with great experience.

7UVncvDevXaIs5N_ED1gEA.text: Atmosphere is dark and trendy. Food was very good as well as the service. Very pricey. Another celebrity chef restaurant that we were skeptical of but enjoyed very much.

dW1rerQYVehX3ag8QktpTg.text: The service here was fantastic! The sushi amazing. We also had several appetizers which were delicious!  The interiors of the restaurant was beautiful as well. Highly recommend this restaurant.

FIIM38e2GARdZtu-a702PA.text: Best food I have ever had. Price is high but for the highest quality food you can eat.

uhDyeQagvBsFAjvc2IoDvg.text: Staying at the MGM as usual, and noticed the Iron Chef opened a restaurant here, thought that I'll try it out.  Gotta say, it's not bad, but definitely nothing to be excited about. I've had better sushi else where.  Ordered the oyster foie gras to start. Steamed oysters topped with uni and foie gras. If they can just use a slightly bigger and more briny oysters, maybe it'll be even better.   Ordered the Chef's choice sushi, the fish are good, rice perfectly seasoned. Unfortunately, what didn't work for me is the portion of the rice. Way too much rice. I've been to countless sushi restaurants around the world, this place might have the most rice. I don't think I've got a small mouth, but seriously, I don't know how girls can eat the sushi in one bite. Maybe some adjustments?  After stuffing myself with all the sushi rice. I decided to ordered some sorbet. Great colours and presentation, but not the best sorbet I had.   It's just unfortunate that I can only give a 3 star review to an iron chef restaurant. I might be a bit more picky than your average Joe, but I was expecting more than average. We are talking about  Vegas + Iron Chef here.

mRWCSMANmQskEY9iXue0nw.text: The Spicy Crab Legs were delicious, just the right amount of heat.  The Seared Black Cod is really, really good.  Flaky and tender.  Im not a fan of fish skin and the meat slides right off it. Get a side of rice to go with it, the sauce is thick and I needed something besides the fish to soak it up .  The Chocolate flaming ball was incredible, marshmallow and chocolate ice cream in the center.       Staff was friendly and knowledgeable.   Cocktails were fantastic.  Place is very clean.  Only down side is the price.  $170.00 for 1 person and I only had 2 drinks.  But I'd definitely go back and try something different.

BIaOq7zChEbUCEiIFugKVg.text: One of the best restaurants I've had the chance to go to in Vegas. We picked a variety of sushi sashimi and makis, which came progressively. Everything is really tasty and freshly made on the spot. The wine list is great, and they offer amazing Japanese beer. You will have to make a reservation even during the week.  Would be a 5* if service wasn't so pushy. We felt like we were disappointing the server when we picked our own choices instead of his recommendations.

gPhh1VpHhcPuFU4j6_gSbg.text: Morimoto is a must. Service is impeccable- both management and staff were very friendly and very anticipatory to our group. Even the AGM and GM stopped by to greet us. Though only dining for the desserts (which are off the chart! Make sure you order the donuts) we will be back for the main courses as we saw too many delicious looking creations pass by for surrounding parties. Ambiance is open and very welcoming. We will surely be back much more frequently

qK1TpF8eRcKOdeI0Goy82g.text: had a delicious amazing tuna Pizza something that you are going to Blown Away. Good portion size in sushi rolls.  also had a seafood spicy stew was very flavorful shellfish Seafood was a little overcooked but still very flavorful. Heather confit of duck this was so tender so flavorful is very delicious.   desserts over all disappointment I don't think they fit the menu too sweet and don't taste that great chocolate black forest looks awesome flambe!  but alcohol is way too strong chocolate gets over burned not really edible not worth the show. The two others that I had looks great didn't taste that great donuts, cheesecake feels like they've been made weeks in advance flavors are not there for me.

oKUCaD-ZWQhtDWW-jkitJQ.text: Was in town on business, staying at the Signature and had a night to myself.  Why not try this place I thought, it's connected to the towers and the Grand and has a famous guy's name on the sign.   Upon arrival I was greeted by a very efficient and friendly hostess who offered me a seat at the sushi bar or a table ...it was early Friday night and the place wasn't busy yet.   My waiter was great,  explained everything on the menu to me.  I opted to start with the whitefish carpaccio, which came plated with a large amount of mixed greens - it was very good, but the excellent taste of the fish was overpowered by the very heavy coating of dressing on the salad.   My advice, ask for light dressing so you can enjoy the taste of the fish.   Moved on to the braised cod, again, very heavy on the sauce...and I SWEAR the glaze tasted exactly like the VH sauce from the jar (although I'm sure it wasn't, right??).  Everything plated very nice and cooked perfectly.  A little pricy, but someone has to pay for the Morimoto name

35pHwZ9JaJiOMzYjDCfiVg.text: We had a large group and since we had the foresight to make a reservation, we were seated promptly. The waiter gave us the hard sell on the tasting menu though he could offer no tantalizing details about that option. That combined with the price convinced us it wasn't a good fit for our large group. No problem, waiter decides he can offer us less food for less cost per person. It was boggling. We ordered off the menu. And seemingly in different time zones. The food arrived at unreasonable intervals. We were assured this was normal. (Ah, Doy!) But that doesn't explain why a steak came out well ahead of my delicate fish dish. Well ahead. The food was good, the service kinda hard to detect and overall the experience just annoying. The food would be better if the experience was improved - two entrees that should always be served simultaneously.

8MV8POmlIkjyIgA8wazz1w.text: Everything here is good! Starting from the tuna pizza, foie gras, tacos, sushi, steak, and desserts. My choice when I eat here is  1. Tuna pizza  2. Foie gras 3. Uni sushi and more uni sushi 4. Ribeye steak 5. Cheesecake If I could I'd give em 6 Stars!

n1P-xgiXzD0vSQP6zpEZOQ.text: I love the location in Boca Raton - however i did not enjoy this one as much.  The service gets a five - or six if they had more stars. The food however was good and above average but clearly not up to the same standards as the boca location.  We had a wide variety of dishes that waiter suggested. One however could only be described as fish spam - not good.  One other negative was the waiter asked if anyone had food allergies - one of our party is lactose intolerant - he acknowledged it and brought out cream cheese with the fish spam - and set it in front of the guy - hmmmm.  Overall a solid four but not worth the price given the average to slightly above average of the dishes.

B2W3P28RGC-kclGC0ReBZA.text: Amazing experience. The food was perfect! I couldn't have asked for a better or more knowledgeable waitress than Christine. The setting is comfortable and the lighting is just right. I ate the lobster here and it was perfect. I had lobster the day before at Emeril's, it was by far no comparison to the flavor and preparation as here at Morimoto. I would recommend this restaurant to anyone that can appreciate good quality food and service.

Ro5bxgy49n7bTApCIDz2jQ.text: Yet another example of how LV is now home to the best restaurants anywhere.  I had the omakase (not sushi omakase) so could have food from the sushi bar and kitchen.  There was a steamed clam topped with foie gras which was a really delicious combination and also a seared wagyu carpaccio with a very light oil sauce that basically melted in your mouth.  The sushi was great and I added a few more pieces because hey, why not, you're in Vegas!  And of course, can't forget the sake - just trust them unless you really know what you're doing.  What really stood out was the service which starts with Monica and Jim but their example is followed by the entire team.  Can't wait to go back!

umVJFQOqnXQLkIvOndk6_w.text: wow!  amazing presentations of food offerings, artist perfection!  we did the 6 course meal with our 9 year old kiddo.  we loved every single bite.  i won't go into the specific details of our dishes, but you must try this restaurant if you are a foodie.  the only caveat is the price.  we had a bottle of expensive sake, 3 dinners; our bill was $800.00.

iG11G2vQC9-Acjbx8d2J0A.text: Wonderful hospitality from manager Nick and our friendly server Matt!!  Had an amazing dinner the other night.  Here are some must haves: Seafood Teppanyaki and the Buri Bop!  So delicious!  Thank you Morimoto!!  We will definitely return.

hdxxqf3w1Y2nyBE8kZgjMw.text: By far the best experience we've had during our week in Vegas. Making the reservation was a breeze, we choose the "surprise me" option and the waiter chose or dishes for us based on our budget- and there is not a single thing I didn't absolutely love! Here's what we had from what I remember: Some kind of whitefish tacos- BOMB. Marinated fish, simply dressed with perfectly crunchy shells. Sea Bass Salad- the sea bass what marinated in a ginger soy sauce and surrounded a greens salad with a lemon-line vinaigrette. A+ Sushi/Sashimi- too many to name! We told him we wanted ~40% sushi, and he definitely delivered. All the nigiri had a bit of wasabi between the gosh and rice, so watch out for that. Marinated Cod- literally fell apart. So good. I can't recommend this place enough. And Prince our waiter did a fantastic job, ask for him when you go!

amP5bMLGDS4c5sO29mo-4A.text: Fresh fish and solid sushi but not worth the price or the hype.   Don't get me wrong, the fish was super fresh and the portions of fish were sizeable, however for $135 dollars I was expecting something more tus just your Americanized sushi bar. I got the chefs sushi sampler and I was blown away by the amount of food I got. Unfortunately they are making up for quality with quantity.   The Chef's sushi sampler was an assortment of nigiri (hamachi, Saba, unagi, salmon, shrimp, tuna and fatty tuna) with three maki rolls: a beautiful symmetric mosaic roll, a mackerel and chives roll and your standard shrimp tempura roll. As I said, the fish was great, fresh and big portions. I got real grated wasabi (not just horseradish with green food coloring) and the fatty tuna was buttery and melt in your mouth  fresh, however the rolls were disappointing. The mackerel and chives roll was overpowered by the chives, and the ebi tempura roll was forgettable. I would have much rather had tako or even a spicy tuna roll Instead.   The service was also not what I would expect from Morimoto. I arrived at 5 pm so that it wouldn't be too crowded. The hostess that took me to my table either was having a bad day or has resting b*tch face syndrome. One of the staff members gave me a plate of sashimi (which I thought was part of my chef's special) and then another one took it away a few minutes later. Lucky for them and the guy who ordered the sashimi, I hadn't put my chopsticks on the sashimi plate yet. This made me somewhat sad as I was given an awesome sashimi plate, gotten my hopes up and then it was taken away with no apology or acknowledgement from the server.   My server was attentive and the food was prepared quickly, however once I paid and left, not the sushi chefs at the bar where I was sitting, not the wait staff, not even the hostesses said anything on my way out. It made me feel as if they were thinking: "great, we got his money, we don't have to be nice or care if he comes back or not"  I don't know if I'd come back. I didn't find the chefs selection particularly creative or inspired especially compared to other sushi places or sushi Ota in San Diego. The service was alright I guess, but I rather see a show with that money instead of spending it on decent sushi.

rYgEE6Y8mTQ-EFM74nJqng.text: We dined here yesterday for our anniversary. The meal and service were exquisite. The Kakini hot appetizer (10 hour braised pork belly over conjee) was beyond amazing. We also enjoyed two sushi rolls, braised shishito peppers and the hot stone bowl pork and rice dish (the name escapes me). For dessert we had to try the fiery chocolate tart. They also gave us a complimentary apricot sorbet because we were celebrating our anniversary, which was also delicious. Would happily come back!

photos.caption: Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. A few second too late to document the complete chocolate sphere

4H06NyLA8Y7_zS6cD4j-Tg.text: i gave it 4/5 stars because of the price. It's a major mark up in price for his name and the hotel.   Food. It was great! We stayed away from sushi and sashimi since we have plenty of good places in bay area.   We ordered oyster w foie gras and uni. This was rich & flavorful! How can you go wrong with uni and foie gras in oyster?!? It is on the sweeter side. But it was still great. Def worth trying.   green tea cold noodle. pass on it. For that $$ you can get better noodles at home. They cooked the noodle perfectly and sauce was good. Need more soy sauce/salt.   Duck confi fried rice. two thumbs up! so good!! Def worth the try.   My mom had a tonight's special w Alaska snapper w shaved caviar. She loved it.   My husband and I had the yellow tail 'bop' and the pork 'bop.' (i forget the actual name of the dishes). Basically it's a bi bim bop in its fancy pantsy glory. Super tasty, but it was not worth $35 per 'bop.' Husband and i agree.. we'd probably pay $25 for it. Again the mark-ups due to his name.   Then we had sorbet and fiery chocolate ball dessert. Both were delicious!   Overall, great experience.. great food! Really tasty. Most of the dishes.. we gladly pay $5-10 less than what they charged.

eHCAqIZuz6lwUvIDnLzJVw.text: Amazing bites of food. Toro tartar is a must. We ordered lots of apps and made an amazing tasting meal.

Everything from the ambiance to the service and of course the food were fantastic! The tuna tacos and sushi were delicious! Definitely making dinner plans here next time I'm in Vegas.

EYd1Ba3EW9CnY6F07qXjkA.text: This could be the best seafood I have eaten.... great atmosphere. Trendy. Beautiful. Nice staff.   I ordered a Seafood Pot and it was excellent. We also had the ribs for an appetizer and they were excellent. We had cheesecake for dessert and it was very tasty. Everything was great. It is a little pricey but worth it.

4mHAxbbBpc-bgVSwxsigrQ.text: Excellent service, classy but comfortable environment, and thoughtfully crafted cuisine.  Came here for the opening night and had an enjoyable evening. Each plate we ordered was delicious - my favorites were the black cod, calamari tempura salad, and yellowtail rolls. I tried the cheesecake and chocolate mousse.  Both were great but the chocolate mousse was more memorable.

hjRG9I42vpIFrgUIe9FNhQ.text: The Iron Chef did not disappoint! Great food (including portions), great cocktails, great service, great atmosphere, giant bill. Seriously, the most expensive dinner check I've ever even witnessed (let alone paid) for two people. Was it worth it? Hmmm... Yeaaahh. Will I go back for more? Absolutely, as soon as I make my next/first/only million..!

hc8pg0Hq2GGMHn20LXqJfg.text: The chef's platter was the way to go. We had a mix of all types of sushi, and all of the fish were fresh, delicious, and amazing. The classic spicy tuna and salmon were melt in your mouth and the more rare uni was to die for. This experience from world renown Chef Morimoto was one of the best sushi experiences that I've ever had.

S_6S9IHJDB5z8HkyBCA3kw.text: Morimoto was an amazing experience! We went here on a Sunday night around 9:45.  We waited 15 minutes to be seated.   We followed the waiter's recommendation of one appetizer and one entree per person to share with the table.   We had the beef carpaccio, short ribs and rock shrimp tempura.  All three dishes were delicious! My favorite app was the beef carpaccio.  For dinner, we ordered the pork belly bib bim bap (this was cooked at the table), the black cod and the rock fish.  The rock fish came whole and was so tender.  The black cod was extremely flavorful and was my favorite main dish. The bib bim bap was probably the best I've ever had.   We also ordered a couple cocktails, which were good, but the food was the showcase of our experience.   High recommend Morimoto!

TUetNzXCnoaogibQqQ8ieA.text: I wasn't leaving this trip without giving Morimoto a try and although the meal was lite, it was a tasty one.  I had just got down having a big dinner but it didn't mean I couldn't squeeze in a snack. I grabbed a seat in the bar area and ordered a few plates of Oyster foie gras. These were easily the most I've ever spent on oysters and were worth it. The combination of the oysters, seared foie gras and teriyaki sauce was great. The oysters also included uni that didn't stand out enough to justify it's presence but I guess you can say it adds to the oysters somehow.   Oysters and beers were it for this order leaving this to be more of a "To Be Continued" type of review rather than a full review. I plan to return for steaks & sushi which I'm sure will change my current rating. Not enough to fully review but the oysters alone definitely earns four stars.  Dinner 4/3/2018

iDoqpVZYv0G44xv0NZJ0Ag.text: Asian fusion restaurants are the best way to transform money into culinary delight. Unfortunately, Morimoto was not supremely delightful. The tuna tartare was deserving of special praise, but the special oysters and lobster dish weren't impressive especially considering supremely high prices. Worth another try, as the menu is expansive, but this was the least memorable meal I had on my first trip to Vegas.

fmwdbtoosMtgqi64aM_1Mw.text: Moritmoto is my favorite restaurant in Las Vegas.  The service is always great. The food is perfection.   We ordered california rolls for appetizers. Simple, delicate, delicious... For dinner, my friend ordered the "seafood toban yaki", which is a mirage of loster, king crab, mussels, clams and lobster jus, served with white rice.  My friend loved it.  I ordered the "whole roasted lobster epice", a whimsical treat for your pallet with garam masala, served with lemon creme fresh and fresh roasted vegetables.  Quite possibly one of the best lobster dish I have ever had. Every bite was embraced and I literally closed my eyes to enhance the experience of all the flavors in my mouth. Yes, it was that good!  For dessert, we were served a complimentary dessert since it was my birthday. We also ordered the fiery salty caramel chocolate tart. This dessert is to be experienced at least once in your life, if only for the presentation...  I will definitely be back to Morimoto's.  It's my favorite restaurant. Like all of Chef Morimoto's creations, everything i've had so far had a beautiful, artistic presentation. The food is perfection. The service is top notch. The ambiance mirrors delicate Japanese beauty and elegance with exotic photographs by Yasumichi Morita.   I will certainly be back again...

photos.caption: Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

YksAzwCtIvl5IvcxEXZs5Q.text: This is one of the best Japanese restaurants I've been to. The ambiance of the restaurant is nice and very modern. The favorite was the Oyster Foie Gras, this dish was so good, I could've eaten the whole order myself! We also got the sushi combination, the fish was cut so well and the rice was made perfectly, every bite was melt in your mouth. The 16 oz Snake River Farm Ribeye was delicious, it comes on a hot plate with a sauce, but you don't even need the sauce and the steak was cooked perfectly to a medium rare. The Duck Confit Fried Rice was really good as well, I only wish that there was more! Then we finished it off with the Blueberry Panna Cotta, it was so good, not too sweet and super creamy, and I'm usually not a dessert person.  The quality of the food here is superb and it reflects in the price, but I believe that you get what you pay for. The service was super attentive and the staff are all very nice. The dress code is casual and a reservation was easy to make the same day for a Saturday on Memorial weekend. I would definitely come here again.

6bFZWHFJCqWIApBLNeDj5w.text: My husband and I went for dinner for date night. Made a same day reservation with no issues. We decided to order the surf and turf and the chef choice sushi with some hot sake. Everything was delicious. The quality of the sushi was out of this world. Service was amazing. Great experience.

eaTNgjZRW0ITUmxYgMxQ6w.text: My wife and I went there last weekend, what a culinary delight! Hats off to the manager (Gary, I think) and his staff as well. This place is a step above the other restaurants you'll find on the strip. Stop reading and go check it out, SERIOUSLY! You won't regret it.

oX-lTXWlbw1-jv7q5D_gQA.text: Omakase + Chef's Sashimi Combination   The omakase came with lobster tail and A5 wagyu ribeye, seafood bisque, toro tartare, wagyu beef carpaccio and a fiery chocolate tart. Everything was made to perfection.  The ambience had a very outgoing vibe. Servers were very attentive.

bU0qmGXJxs6fgN9G7Sy0Vw.text: First of all i just want to say I've always been a huge fan of the Iron chef competition show on the food network and even more a fan of chef Masaharui Morimoto. To see him cook and compete is like watching Boccelli perform live. Sensational and out of this world. His stye of  creative dishes look like works of art, and his knife skills? unreal. He Trully is a maser chef. I only wish he was there when i dined at his restaurant...Out of all my fine dining indulging dining experiences during my stay in Las Vegas this was literally the highlight.   Toro Tartar was exquisite, rich and buttery. The sauces which came with the dish paired with the tartar. The sushi nigiri combo was excellent. Perfect ratio of fish to rice which was cooked perfectly. The cod was was like butter and not to sweet. The Morimoto sushi appetizer delectable. The duck duck goose was my favorite. Drawn to the dish right away such a cool concept excellent flavor, and simply delicious. The wagyu carpaccio to die for.   The whole experience blew me away. And the service was stellar, dishes were timely replaced and drinks constantly refilled. Hands down the experience was exceptional from start to finish

8Ju_KhZfD9AdNrPeCmlFhw.text: The ambiance: 10/10. Although it is in the MGM Grand, this place is straight-up vibey. Just being at the restaurant makes you feel cool. While there's lots of seating, I like the sushi bar for a more casual night!   The service: 10/10. Impeccable.   The food: 11/10. The Hamachi Tacos might be the best tacos I've ever eaten. Additionally, the sushi is always fresh and perfectly crafted. The drinks are even fire!   One of the best dinners that you can have in Vegas. Go, go, go!

u3EeCIX6Uw1oeLZRlBCCXg.text: We visited this place after a friend of ours recommended it. I am glad we came to this place. The restaurant is located inside the MGM Hotel towards the back. It's easy to find. Can't miss it.  We were seated immediately and the staff was very courteous and welcoming. As soon as the host seated us, the server came out almost immediately and asked us if it was our first time so he could help us with our menu.  The server was seen walking back and forth and was visible the entire we were there so if we needed anything, we could get his attention right away.   The place is well decorated and spacious in their seating. They can also accommodate large parties as well.  The sushi was of superb quality. They also have many options fo sake.  We walked out with a $400 bill but we thought it was well worth it for every item that we had.  Will definitely come back when I am back in Vegas

TUf2_D8EwwX2VFDj0AZ9MA.text: Favorite sushi spot on the strip! Love sitting at the bar because they have TVs and great people watching =). I've been here multiple times so I can say the service and food is amazing not based on just a ONE TIME experience. Get the tuna pizza and the save room for the FIERY CHOCOLATE TART!!!! You're welcome!

NuaJXe61-lJ_ZfPv81nf9w.text: amazing place! Amazing food! Amazing service! The food is so good from sushi to entrees , the waiter was so helpful about the menu. Great place for date,friends to have dinner and drinks ! Pricey but worth it!

zANUE7c4riKRJnh77RMcaA.text: SO WORTH IT. End to end a 5 star experience. We started with beautiful sake and an Asian pear cocktail which was delightful. The oyster fois grois was one of the most delicious things I've ever eaten. We also had the sashimi and whatever their take on bi bim bop was. And finished it off with a snow crab roll for good measure. Everything was indescribably delicious and a dream come True. It was everything we hoped it would be.

9WCxQ78BgrEcAR6hszHrSA.text: Came here for dinner and it was good. Our waiter was really knowledgeable when it came to recommending items on the menu. I had told them I had a shellfish allergy and they were really on top of making sure nothing was cross contaminated and that I was ordering things which were okay. To star we ordered the pork chashu salad (which is big enough for more than one person), the osyters, and the gyoza. All of this was delicious. The oysters came with foie gras on them and were just amazing. The salad was a tad spicy, but oh so good. The gyozas were also really delicious. For the main course, we ordered their seared snapper, ishi taki chashu bop, and the ishi yaki buri bop. The bops they come and complete the bowl and stir it together tableside which we thought was neat. These were really good and filling. The seared snapper did not disappoint either. When it came to dessert, we had to try their signature caramel dish and the dessert sushi. The sushi was done so nicely and it was delicious. The caramel dish was exquisite. The presentation is just amazing. The reason for 4/5 stars is because we asked for hot sake and got cold and the waiter at times was a missing in action. They also brought us out the wrong bowls in the beginning and we had to send them back because they contained the wrong protein.

Absolutely loved everything. All the food we ordered had us full. And the chocolate ganache for dessert was amazing

LwVRH3IuWF-2EP9xbi1hcg.text: How could we resist stopping by The Vegas version of my NY Chelsea market favorite!  I love the decor and the view down MGM's restaurant row.  What can be better than great sushi with a front row view of the Saturday night bachelorette party/club crowd strolling by?  Summer special at Morimotos has a great selection of appetizers, sushi combo, and a choice of the braised black cod and a 4oz NY steak. Both entrees sounded amazing but we settled on a cod.  It was deliciously buttery and the sauce was not too sweet.   The sushi combination for $100 for 20 pieces was fresh and a solid pick but nothing special.   The chirashi sushi bowl however was otherworldly!  This dish was packed with huge chunks of fresh cut fish, not the scraps you usually get. The assortment of fish and quality was amazing.  I found myself wishing I had one more day in Vegas just so I could come back and have it again!

photos.caption: Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The most amazing chirashi bowl!!

y6siN4FhZ8J3tO1os1YPPQ.text: First time here and definitely not my last. I'm a huge fan of sushi. The reviews were great and being it's Iron Chef Morimoto's restaurant, I had to give it a try. I've been to numerous sushi restaurants and always order salmon sashimi. I tried the salmon sushi here and hands down, the best I've ever had. I don't eat much rice, but thought I would give it a try here. Both the salmon and the rice melted in my mouth with each bite. The service and decor were over the top. I didn't even have to look up for a second and my dirty plate was taken away. The prices are a little more than some places, but honestly I do think it's on point. The quality is through the roof. I cannot wait to come back. Thank you to all of you for taking such good care of us!!

RYWtZWAfLvBfEJWb7h0udg.text: We had a couple sushi rolls, the pork chop, angry chicken and the morimoto sashimi. Everything was fine. I'm not sure anything really blew my skirt up. The pork chop was overcooked slightly. The chicken also slightly overcooked. Sushi was very cold. It was all good. It did not give our favorite Minneapolis Japanese restaurants a run for the money and fell far below New York places that we love.   Our server was like the interrupting cow joke. He would sneak up behind me and "Moooooooo!" and interrupt every single fugging time. He seemed inexperienced and downright rude at times.   Basically this was a $250 disappointment. I think if you have cash to blow and you don't have high expectations... Go for it.   Otherwise, I'd skip.

iBdFP9ZctxSEzReM_A-wUA.text: Excellent food, attentive service and great atmosphere!!! The only downside (which I don't mind) was the overpowering taste of the ginger in the duck meat ball soup. Quite spicy and clears the throat/sinuses.   First time having toro and omg it was so fresh and melt into the mouth delish! Truly outstanding! The desserts we had was tofu mousse (perfect sweetness) and the fiery chocolate tart was so good and a great way to top off the night).  Truly an outstanding place to indulge! Hats off to the iron chef!

iodDAUZxVbSMrzgEviDEGA.text: I thought that the novelty of eating at an iron chef's restaurant would wear off and the food would just be like any other nice restaurant. However, it really wasn't and the experience was great throughout the whole night!  First off, the service was fantastic. My glass was never half full (they managed to do this without feeling over bearing), and our waiter Jeff was so knowledgeable and polite. He even offered to create a menu for us based on tastes that we told him we enjoyed.  We passed on his offer, however, but were really happy with our choices. The yellowtail buri bop seems like a typical rice dish on paper, but it turns out to be quite the experience! They bring out a blazing hot stone bowl with rice and yellowtail sashimi in it. They then sear the raw fish in the sides of the bowl and fry the rice with an egg and sweet soy sauce. In the end, you get a delicious bowl of sweet rice and perfectly tender and seared fish. It was amazing.  The Morimoto chirashi was probably the best dish we got and the best chirashi I've had. It came with tons of variety (menu says 10-12) including salmon, tuna, octopus, egg, salmon roe, yellow tail, eel and some other types of fish that I gladly devoured without knowing what they were.  All this was served on top of delicious sushi rice and it just all tasted so good. I usually scarf down my food but I made sure to savor every bit because it was just that good!  Like I said, eating here is an entire experience. The servers are so knowledgeable and have that typical Japanese politeness and kindness. Like they say, Chef Morimoto really blended Japanese cuisine with a lot of other cuisines, and you can tell from the menu. There is not only fresh sushi, but also a lot of other types of meats and fish from different cultures and inspirations. It's definitely pricy, being in the MGM and all, but you're in Vegas so what can you expect? I'd say it's a beautiful experience, just like any Vegas show that you'd go to, and it's worth the try!

VfThXhLuLE0TSzscnF1hUQ.text: I will be upfront, I visited Morimoto a couple years ago when I was staying at the MGM Grand. Since I am staying at the MGM next month, then I was reminiscing and remembering my amazing dinner. One major note for people eating on a budget, it's expensive. You're paying for an amazing dinner, and I believe everyone should treat themselves; however, for my dad and I it was about a 250-300 dinner. Granted, we got drinks which was probably a third of the bill which isn't uncommon at all at a nice restaurant, but be mindful this will not be a cheap dinner.  For starters we tried at the time a sashimi sampler which was organized with 6 pieces in a rainbow tower of various high quality fish. Meanwhile I had a steak, not A-5 Wagyu or Kobe, my dad had an amazing pork dish, and both of us had desert. Each dish was exceptional, and it definitely had a Japanese flair to it. I say flair because you aren't going here for typical Izakaya dishes, or a typical Ramen joint. These are upscale dishes with inspiration of Japanese cooking, or taking something traditional and elevating it in a modern and exciting way. Similar to a new-American restaurant, or a high class French restaurant that takes traditional cuisine to another level. I am mentioning this since you shouldn't expect Morimoto to be a typical Japanese restaurant, and you have to expect a high-class Japanese restaurant that would likely be at least 1, but most likely 2-3 Michelin stars in Japan.   I apologize I am not going into more details of each dish since it was 2 years ago, and I mostly recall it as having an amazing meal of top quality. On top of that, it's near the Casino floor, and you don't have to dress up for it. There are plenty of people wearing shorts with a collar shirt, and the nice thing about many good to great Vegas restaurants is you can get in on the night of, minus some weekends or a big night like Valentines.

71ZdRj72wU-LLa9CsbTGOw.text: Quite possibly one of the best meals of my life! I got adventurous and was not disappointed. The duck fried rice will haunt my dreams. Spicy shrimp appetizer that my kid fought me over was delicious. Sashimi was perfection. Only complaint was that service seemed a bit frazzled but the food more than made up for it. A Lil Jon sighting was cool too. Also the tamarind ribs were a big hit at the table.

eOMoBQLa086dDAKgPkDFOA.text: Staff was on point. Friendly and attentive.   Drinks were unique and delightful.   Food was amazing. The $100 sushi sampler was our starter. We couldn't decided so we got one of each (10 piece each and a roll each). We shared two entrees, black cod and the bibimbop. Ended the meal with the mango coconut dessert for me and he got whiskey.   The tables that flanked us both got omakase. If we didn't want to try all the fish we would have too! It's 6 courses that ends with the fiery chocolate smores dessert.   Not a bad way to spend a bday.

vqCfRbgfeCPkUXKnazPYWA.text: The BEST sushi! That's it, that should really my the end of my review.  Everything I tried at Morimoto was excellent, even the most basic rolls were amazing.  You can tell the fish is of the highest quality as everything was not only flavorful, it literally melts in your mouth.  This place is always busy, but the staff is very accommodating.  If I'm Vegas, make sure you stop by!

HWPErwJgncxI2VfbD6Glyw.text: Visited on my last night in Las Vegas with my co-workers and was blown away.  First of all the restaurant itself is absolutely gorgeous and our server was awesome. It was a really unique and fun dining experience.  The leader of our group ordered a bunch of dishes for us all to share (which I personally love - you get to try a bit of everything!). We had edamame, Morimotos' famous sashimi, an amazing rice bowl which was prepared with an egg yolk in a flaming hot pot tableside, sticky ribs, and a selection of sushi rolls.   Everything I tasted was super delicious, fresh, and bursting with flavour. The sushi rolls we had were hands down the best I have ever had.  Would absolutely recommend coming to visit if you get the chance!!

WPf6Yx8Au3atf1Ud7kZoVw.text: Tasting menu was everything I dreamt it would be. Great location, amazing food, attentive wait staff. A very special place!

M3lL31lrDmrfj6blGUqDEw.text: Our other planned dinner spot was closed, and D wasn't hungry yet, so I seized the opportunity for a quick few rolls at the bar in Morimoto and was not disappointed - this is the best sushi I've had in a long, long time.  I ordered oh-toro, red snapper, yellowtail maki, and salmon maki. (I later enjoyed watching a nearby patron order a spicy yellowtail maki and spicy salmon maki - as much as that's my go-to order for sushi, I didn't want any spicy sauce muddling my experience of this level of fresh fish!). Everything was impeccably presented, delicious, and fresh. Service was prompt and friendly, but not overbearing, and I'd absolutely go back for another visit.

Lp2-uZZl23HUMQKGvb76Yg.text: Food was amazing service even better. Top notch. I will definitely send my VIP clients here. Don't usually leave reviews but this venue deserves one. No complaints

0PbT6Muic7mg312L7UDwtg.text: This meal was pretty disappointing. We had been recommended this restaurant by some friends of ours, and so were pretty excited about going there. It's a nice setting - we remember it when it was a previous Japanese restaurant. With prices this high, we expected the food to be out of this world -but it just wasnt. The wagyu beef carpaccio was just average  - the sashimi tasted good, but nothing special and the sushi rolls were very fresh but again, just very average. Wont be returning.

oAzx3CnFG6AgUp20BQbm-A.text: We enjoyed our dinner here. Dont come here thinking you will get quantity, its all about quality. The experience we had here was well worth the money. And having a chance to eat at a restaurant from an iron chef is a great lifetime experience.

n4Mzlpv0S8ZgqZ4fXkH2vg.text: I stopped here for dinner on the last night of my latest Vegas adventure. It was definitely worth the wait. Since this was a solo visit I opted to sit at the Sushi Bar. As soon as I took my seat I was warmly greeted by my server, Keiko.  I took a minute to peruse the menu and decided to begin my evening with their Sake Flight. It consisted of four different selections that ranged from light and floral to dark and smokey. My favorite was aged like a whiskey and was a fantastic sipper.  I chose the $50.00 Sushi Sampler, which includes a Spicy Tuna Roll and ten different pieces of Sushi. Everything was impeccably fresh and beautifully presented. The only piece I didn't like was the Mackerel. It was just too fishy for me. In the future, I would probably skip the sampler and just order the Sushi individually. I might spend a little more, but I'd get exactly what I like.  I had originally planned to try something off the Dinner Menu, but since it was my last night in Vegas and assurances from my server that it wasn't "too heavy", I decided to try the Fiery, Salty Caramel Chocolate Tart. It was definitely worth the splurge. The combination of flavors and textures matched the flamboyant presentation.  Morimoto is wheelchair accessible (including the Sushi Bar). Service was friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back. Next time we'll sit in the Dining Room and order off the Dinner Menu.

N6H-qTZwmIKxnXcZShG-WA.text: For a Japanese restaurant I was surprised to find all kinds of Asian food on the menu, including Korean bibimbap styled hot stone bowl and some Chinese flavored dish. Since it's a Japanese restaurant I tried to stick to the Japanese dishes like the chirashi, chef's combination sushi, soft shell crab roll and Hamachi kama. The fish was pretty fresh but the fish in my chirashi was cut into various random shapes which makes me feel like they are using scrap fish.   Service was great and they were speedy with our order since we were time crunched to go to a show.  However the flavor and the expectations of a Japanese restaurant weren't met for me. I really wish they would stick to their own cuisine.
