m13oqGuUIqHQOo--ikBz3Q.text: I've been to the original Morimoto in Philadelphia and was quite impressed. The Iron Chef has since expanded his empire all across the country, with multiple branches (Napa being one of them) emphasizing ambience and the celebrity factor while falling short on substance. So it's totally my fault for knowing exactly what I was getting into and choosing to come here anyway.  Still, I had a hefty MGM resort dining credit I wanted to use, I was in the MGM that very moment, and I was hangry, which meant that I wasn't up to trekking all the way to other MGM-affiliated resorts in search of better dining options. So I ventured into Morimoto hoping for some simple nigiri sushi, sashimi, and sushi rolls, but after seeing the hefty prices on the menu, I went all out for the omakase. Even though it leans more towards flash than substance, at least it's the most value-conscious choice on the menu.  To start, I received a course of toro tartare, which came served in a plastic scraping board alongside wasabi, nori paste, and sour cream, plus a small helping of sturgeon caviar on the side. All of this came centered around a large bowl of ice, ostensibly to make the whole course look far larger than it actually was and to provide a photo-worthy "wow" moment. The actual amount of food was rather small, and I would have appreciated some more bread on which I would have spread the tuna tartare, instead of licking it straight off my scraping tool.  Next was a course of wagyu carpaccio. I could barely discern the flavor of the beef because it was so thinly sliced and because it came doused with sauce. This was followed by a seafood stew which at least packed some nice umami flavor despite being rather petite in size. Then came a nigiri course featuring chutoro, yellowtail, red snapper, clam, uni, and mackerel. The uni was the only selection that packed flavor to it; everything else was rather unmemorable. At least they use real wasabi.  I was feeling a bit underwhelmed by the whole dinner at this point; fortunately, the surf and turf course that came next was more than enough to fill me up, even though the turf was rather tough on the outside despite being cooked medium on the inside. The lobster was quite flavorful and came off the shell easily; although no extraction tool was provided at first, I still felt that I had to ask for one in principle.  On this note, service felt a bit forced and rushed. The servers didn't seem to know much about the dishes beyond perfunctory, superficial descriptions, plus there seemed to be a bit of a bro culture among the staff. I noticed that other customers received a wet towel (something that you'd expect upon sitting down at finer Japanese-themed establishments), yet despite my choosing the omakase, with all its courses, I received none.  The omakase ended in predictable fashion - with some literal fireworks. A "fiery" salty caramel tart was exactly that - it was set ablaze before my eyes until I was told to blow it out before it melted completely. Sure made for some Instagram-worthy theatrics.  All in all, if you're looking for an atmospheric dining experience that isn't going to be terribly traditional from a Japanese sense, then this Morimoto branch does the trick. Skip the high-priced a la carte items and settle for the omakase, where at least you're getting good value.

eDY7rVIQqNzKfW5ccKOlmA.text: This restaurant has been on my friend's list to try so we decided to make a reservation on our Girl's trip in Vegas.   This restaurant is a Japanese restaurant. It was opened by Iron Chef Morimoto. This is my first time eating at any of his restaurants and I was super impressed. I love the vibe and ambiance.   We got to try a bit of everything.   Pork Chashu Salad- I loved the pork chashu.   Braised Black Cod-Amazing. My favorite dish of the night.   Seafood toban yaki-this dish had lobster, king crab, mussels, clams in a refreshing light sauce. It was good.    California Rolls-super yummy  Fiery Chocolate Tart-great fire show but you can taste the spiced rum    Overall, LOVE LOVE LOVE! I will be back.

tAyM6cpkb32ilBIDWK3KLQ.text: I wasn't even hungry having stuffed my face for 3 days and it still blew my socks off even with very high expectations.  Let's just get right to it, location within MGM and decor is just fine.  If I'm going to pay through the nose, it's gotta be unique, full bodied flavors, and stand out and uber fresh.  Well Morimoto in my view did all that on this busy Tuesday night where the conference for 7-11 owners was going on.  I ordered the chirashi bowl while other friends ordered the laksa, congee w/ 15-hour braised pork, fried rice and two folks ordered their 6-course sample menu.  We were all quite impressed.  Laksa was thick, full bodied curry flavors with good but not great amounts of noodles.  Fried rice was infused with great garlic flavors which means the wok was super hot and fried nicely. The congee and 12-hour braised pork was also again full of flavor, not just the pork but the congee itself.  But for me, I felt lucky ordering the chirashi bowl, for $35, I've not had its equal. Bite sized fish of WIDE assortment and light vinegar flavored rice with shaved seaweed.  Readers, they didn't just put fish on top, it felt like they strategically embedded fish within the rice and thus I felt there was a very generous amounts of fish. Tuna, hamachi, salmon, shrimp, white fish, mackerel, all of which were super fresh. Shrimp and tamago also included. What caught me by surprise was a shiitake mushrooms soaked in some sweetened liquid that added something very new to a chirashi bowl experience. They also made the slices bite sized which made for even more enjoyment. That's more work to prepare the bowl...  I sampled the 6-course and I must say it stood out. Once again the flavors were just on-point and uniquely presented. Nigiri, tuna tartare, seafood stew, dessert, etc.  Two people for $140 for what you got I felt was fair. Again, you're in LV, 5-star hotel and a celebrity chef establishment. Can't say other celebrity chef places can hit the same mark.  We pretty much felt like we were judging Morimoto when he did Iron Chef the flavors were so bold, on point and delicious.  I can't wait to come again, it's gonna hurt the pocketbook but there are few places in Vegas where you pay mightily but you also get amazing flavors and good portions for what you pay.  Top 2 chirashi bowls I've ever had world wide. I'll be back.

MMkEMC8adBLdcIGDMlXPdA.text: Morimoto is one of the best places you can get Japanese cuisine in Las Vegas. They have an excellent selection of seafood and a huge selection of sake. The staff are attentive and knowledgeable. The quality of the food and presentation were excellent. I started off with the Spicy King Crab and it was an excellent dish and one of the best presentations of Crab I have ever had, and the spice does not overpower the flavor of the crab meat. The Ishi Yaki Chasu-bop was an excellent entree too. It comes with the yellowtail uncooked and it is then seared / cooked right at the table. Overall, a great dining experience.

nYdkfKVmHE-h97JbJCzrqw.text: We ate at the bar during a big convention. Great service and the sushi was amazing! We started with huge bowls of miso soup - could definitely have just shared. We both had the spicy tuna roll. I also had the king crab sashimi, and my boyfriend added a salmon roll. It was so fresh and delicious!

aeSKMmXe5oJxZYC8HNzWSQ.text: We tired to book the same day dining for Saturday but they did not have availability until 945pm but told us we could come back when we were ready to eat dinner to see if the bar area had seating available. We came back at 7pm and there was seating. We were seating promptly. Service was excellent. Very attentive, our water glass was always full! The food was delicious. Waygu carpaccio - delicious, the flavors and toppings paired perfectly Wagyu sukiyaki - 3oz wagyu beef with veggies and noodles. make sure to use the egg dip or you will taste the sweet broth. We also had a side of rice Toro Tartare - was okay. The toro was a little fishy. They had few different sauce choices. Nori paste, Wasabi, sour cream, chives, Morimoto guac, and rice cracker balls and a light soyu  Tofu mousse - delicious. Get all the flavors in one bite.  We will definitely be back. But have to make sure we make reservations beforehand.

AXzYanzkwZnO6Pz_b45Jdw.text: Incredible atmosphere, brilliant menu, delicious food amazingly kind chef and server. I think the Appetizerportions are pretty small.

1ID8MEWuVwfAqz7U2ovKvA.text: Best sushi and sashimi I have had in the states, beating some of the best in NYC and LA.  Beautiful presentation. Interesting appetizers with the pork belly being the winner - melt in your mouth good that people who don't like the greasiness of the pork still liked it.  Also very good were wagyu carpaccio, whitefish carpaccio, kama, and taco. The vegetables and Chinese broccoli were also great such that they were loved by the meat lovers.  Kids loved the black cod and surf and turf. The only one I would skip is the snapper curry entree--overly coconut and oddly needed some spice unlike the rest of the meal.  The desserts were interesting with the black forest as most interesting and delicious. Love that you crack the chocolate and oozes out cherry flavored sauce and then you find some marshmallow-like stuff hidden. The kirsch ice cream was very good with the sauce and rich chocolate mousse.  Service can be slow at times so plan for a leisurely meal.

8k8nNEpUuM93wlmLRVMOAw.text: I had an enjoyable dinner here during a trip to Vegas for CES. The menu contains the standard Morimoto fare (modern Japanese/fusion fare), and is essentially a clone of the Napa/NYC locations. The rock shrimp tempura was solid, and the selection of nigiri I ordered was fairly high-quality as well, with fresh cuts although nothing out of the ordinary.  Service was very friendly and attentive, and a wide variety of wines, beers, sakes, and cocktails are on offer as well. However, I did find myself wishing for a greater variety of sushi, and I was somewhat disappointed that omakase was not available. That being said, this place is definitely a decent option if you're looking for decent-quality sushi or upscale Japanese fare.

BjV0jhE2lNLyCy4UG_F6Pw.text: Morimoto is a master of his craft and it is reflected at his newest restaurant at the MGM. The end-to-end experience was hands down the best dining experience I've had in Vegas. Everything from the top-notch service by our waiter Truman to the execution of Morimoto's signature dish the Buri Bop made this restaurant a must. The toro maki roll was the best sushi I've ever had, the fatty tuna just melted in your mouth. The restaurants Sommelier even stopped by to find the best sake pairing with the meal I had. 5 stars! I will be back.

teUSiUjpTh5i0A6aC0z7bg.text: Food is delicious and great environment and great service. I couldn't believe they charge us $28 for 2 wasabi. It's free everywhere this place is ridiculously cheap.

oMVXtP3uvH0_MxissuP0qQ.text: Omg!!! Food was AMAZING... try the soup with a side of white rice... soup has a spicy after taste and is just right. The lobster and crab were cooked perfectly... Def will come back and worth the price!

WciCSk7bqegooTdUZG1Isg.text: I visited Morimoto almost exactly a year ago today and felt that the duck, duck goose was a revelatory experience. However, we visited again this year and were disappointed.   Negatives: First of all, we made reservations and were still sat right by the entrance to the kitchen. Then, unfortunately, the duck dish did not live up to expectations in my mind. The gooseberry sauce was haphazardly thrown on the plate, the duck breast skin has been rendered JUST enough, and could've used less of a fat cap. The broth was MAYBE 1/3 of a cup of liquid and probably a full tablespoon of lemongrass (way too much, it was overpowering), whereas last time it was a nicely balanced broth. Finally, the rice was the biggest disappointment of the night. I'd dreamed about that rice off and on for a year.. fluffy, with gooey egg and tasty confit duck, and a fresh pop of scallions. This time the rice was undercooked and over-crisped.. the rich yolk couldn't make up for the bite in the rice, it seemed to lack fragrance that I typically associate with rice dishes and, this is a small detail, but no scallions this time.  Positives: My husband had a large, late lunch and did not want a full dinner, so he was prepared to just order sushi rolls. Last year he got the spicy yellowtail roll, but he wanted something simple this time, and he loved his tuna and salmon rolls. We also got sticky ribs, and while they were fairly sweet, they were definitely tasty. We finished the night by splitting the cheesecake dessert, which came recommended by our waiter and was DELICIOUS.   I'm not sure if I'll go back for anything other than dessert, but I think my husband definitely would.

hsx490Q1JmlT9fuf_MKW-A.text: Morimoto is fantastic. I would suggest coming here with a small group so you can try different appetizers. The tuna pizza is a must try. The sushi was well made and beautiful presented. The whole fried fish was well worth it's price. The whole fish entree was $39. The service was excellent. The servers were friendly and knowledgeable. The restaurant was nicely decorated and laid out. The most expensive items were the steaks. It will run you about $90. Morimoto is definitely a pricey restaurant. It will cost about $100/person if you don't get steaks. Of course, in a high end restaurant like this one, the alcohol will cost you. We got a bottle of sake, 600ml, and it was $88. Oh yeah, the flaming chocolate ball. It cost $20, but when you see other tables ordering it, you would want one too. I would recommend Morimoto, especially if you are willing to splurge a bit.

jib1WDSLkU3e7I48Uf2yJw.text: Probably the single best meal I've ever had. From start to finish everything was perfection and completely representative of the Morimoto name. I've watched him for years on Iron Chef.   I had the salmon sushi, snapper and the chocolate tart. Everything was made to perfection. I could die a happy woman right now.   I won't spoil it on the amazing and complex flavors of the flawless execution. Just save your money, hide your kids, and come and have the best food of your life.   Oh and hope that you are seated in Christina's section. Probably the best waitress I've ever had too.

ndVNzB6gkHHJ57pbIAX5Dw.text: We did the chefs tasting 6 course meal and it was by far one of the best meals ever! The sushi is amazing and the main course was surf and turf that I cannot even explain how good it was. The service was also wonderful and very detail of the experience is orchestrated to the moment. h1Vaofph-K3QKZeLOz500g.text: Went for Dinner on 08/07/17 with a  friend.  I HAD AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE.  we order several dishes , and drinks.  Our Server was Mathew. I own a couple of restaurants, all i say, is i wish that guy was working for me. I never had a better server in my life. everything was coming on time, he was very helpful, respectful, with a smile. food was excellent, drinks were solid, and presentation was great. 3 minor things that i feel they can better at are 1) chopsticks are very slippery.I know they look good, but that doesn't matter. 2) even though it's a traditional authentic Japanese place, on specialty rolls they can be a bit more creative , and offer 2-3 rolls that have more creativity and sauces. i know sometimes you cannot taste the fish, but if you give this small option, might be very beneficial 3) the acoustics of the place. all surfaces are hard, and the echo reflects. would be a great idea to spent some $$ and place some soundproofing on ceiling or below the tables....  Overall everything else was perfect. Even our busser Ryan was amazing. Always with a smile, respectful, and very helpful. This place totally worth the $$, and its a 100 times better than Nobu.  Keep up the good work guys. Next time I am in Vegas ill def visit you again Thank you

9HSw8NtUVFg1jcvmuVk3_A.text: I didn't find this place amazing.  The ribs and oyster fois gras were amazing.  The 40-piece sushi platter for $180 was underwhelming - a few choice pieces, and the rest were what I'd expect at a bento box lunch place (the quality was great, but for what we paid we should have gotten more specialty sushi).  The interior is pretty loud - a good party place.    I'd take the money and go to Nobu inside the Hard Rock instead.

eNvb5rC6D1yqoavU0zPQqQ.text: Everything was spectacular. Seafood was fresh and it had a little bit of everything including lobster. The taste was everything I imagined and a little bit more. 2wr-cthgrPt0rVodlw92sw.text: Love that Iron Chef! and wasn't disappointed!  We love Morimoto and have tried his cuisine when in Napa Valley, but recently had a wonderful dinner with family and friends at his new location in Las Vegas.    Everyone's food was succulent and dripped with Iron Chef goodness.  We lucked out to be there the same day he was visiting and was providing a Chef's Taste menu.  OMG!!!  Best thing ever with one course after another of out-of-this-world food.  Then they brought dessert with a flaming sphere of chocolate on fire in a brandy sauce.  Yes, it tasted even better than it sounds.  Go, you will enjoy and nothing less than superb with this chef.  Next on the menu is trying his Disney location.  :)

up15nrG-tLEalK3UAk5KUw.text: A chance to eat at Iron Chef Morimoto's restaurant?  Hell yeah!  Okay, I was thinking traditional Japanese but this is almost like fusion.  The staff is amazing here!  We were greeted by every staff member all night long - I mean every staff member we made contact with; very impressive!  Appetizers:  Spicy tuna tacos, rock shrimp  Scallop Sashimi and Fatty Tuna sushi   Entrees:  Braised Black Cod in a ginger soy reduction, pork chops with apple kimchi and a side of Duck Confit Fried Rice with a fried duck egg.  Deserts:  Black Forest and the Fiery Chocolate Tart.  The food was amazing.  The service was great and the bill ended up less than I expected (but still not cheap).  I would recommend having reservations, but on a non weekend night you may still get in.  Next time I may have to try the Wagyu steak!

tul6JpckJwx7QQUeWFHw5Q.text: I've been to 2 Morimoto locations. One was at The Modern in Hawaii (which is now closed) and I went again while I was at the MGM in Las Vegas. I remember enjoying the food and restaurant in general so it made sense that I would be back!   APPETIZERS:    My favorites are the Toro Tartare $31 and Whitefish Carpaccio $20.   Both are great starters. If you like the idea of mixing fresh tuna with different flavors for an incredible taste, you'll want to try the Toro Tartare. The dish itself comes in an iced bowl with 2 small, clear slabs - one has the Toro and the other has a set of 6 condiments which include wasabi, sour cream, caviar, nori paste, chives, guac & bubu arare. There's also a cup of soy sauce if needed. Scrape off a piece from the Toro 'canvas' and with your 'brush', mix it with variety of flavors from the other 'canvas' and enjoy. Very fun and delicious concept.    The Whitefish Carpaccio requires less creativity, but the presentation and taste itself is amazing. Just thinking about the thinly, sliced sashimi with hot oil, ginger, and yuzu sauce makes my mouth water. The fish just melts in your mouth! MUST GET.    ENTREES:   Japanese A-5 Wagyu 3oz. $90   Boyfriend got this. To be real with y'all...3oz is NOT ENOUGH. No wonder wagyu is so expensive, you need to savor every bite - which is what he did. I managed to try a sample and it was good but I can't afford to be paying $90 for meat the size of a deck of playing cards. I was more than happy to split my lobster entree with him since he was still hungry.   Whole Roasted Lobster 'epice' $45   I love lobster, it's one of my favorite seafood dishes. Since I couldn't get my lobster pho at District One, I was definitely going to get lobster at Morimoto's. You can't go wrong with lobster. This dish was everything I wanted! A beautiful lobster -split open with delicious lemon creme fraiche sauce and veggies. The sauce added a nice tanginess to the already seasoned lobster. The veggies on the side made the whole lobster dish very balanced and flavorful. I had to get a side of rice to go along to complete my perfect meal. I was super happy and satisfied.     DESSERT:   Fiery Chocolate Tart $20   The star of the night. I got so excited watching the chocolate ball get lit up from the rum that I forgot about getting a picture! (Thank you for screenshots snapchat!) If you're a fan of chocolate, this is a must get dessert. I'm not a chocolate person, but I have to admit this was the perfect mix of light and heavy. I liked the sorbet and marshmallow inside of the ball and the ganache logs on the side were also delicious. You can bet we were on a sugar high for the rest of the night!   TL;DR  Definitely try if you have never been to a Morimoto. Great service, food and presentation. Look forward to a very enjoyable dining experience!

bZACywjSjsLgrNaxe5wr3A.text: Came here when it was about a month old. Not even sure if what I ordered is still on the menu, but it was very good. I felt that my main course had a bit too much sauce, so it was a bit salty. Aside from that, I had no complaints. The service was really good, and I liked the atmosphere. I do want to come back and try is again, though. I feel like I made the incorrect choice in the food I ordered. Perhaps I'll update my review at that time. I'm very glad that Masaharu Morimoto has a restaurant, here in Las Vegas! It was a long time coming.

o5syGE_XpUY4L7h7XYsU8Q.text: Absolutely incredible experience. I came with a large party of 10 and we had phenomenal service and a waiter who helped all of us order the right dishes. Located inside the MGM where we were staying, making moves to this place was totally the right decision as a sushi lover.  I'm not even going to touch on the ambiance as it was gorgeous. Instead I'll move right onto the food.  The menu was massive. I was mostly here for sushi so I didn't have a tough time choosing. That being said, I had to go with the miso cod as well as it is a Morimoto fan favorite. The 10 piece sushi combo with a spicy tuna roll was phenomenal. The star piece was probably the salmon as it literally melts in your mouth. My friends raved about the unagi piece. The spicy tuna roll was to die for. I would order millions if my wallet allowed it.   The miso cod was delectable. The fish was cooked perfectly and the sauce was just the right amount of sweet.   I'm docking a star for the surf and turf dish. This dish was super underwhelming. The steak was almost inedible and at a price of $55, that's unacceptable. But, this was my friends dish, not mine... so I don't really care.   I'll be back!

jLAbi3cpHBC45GPgTmMH6g.text: Overall amazing experience! The sushi was very fresh and presented beautifully, and the staff and service were excellent.. highly recommend!

EtKCcXrqoTh6YbWcoJeE3g.text: I got 6 course tasting,  it was good and cool presentation. Probably wouldn't be enough of food for the guy, but I was full! The service is amazing, the food was good but not great, it was okay. Some things I likes more and some less, I would just recommend getting their sushi sampler instead. I hunk $140 is pretty strap for this sort of food.  Huge thanks to the management though for getting us a complementary desert, due to our incident for staying at Mandalay Bay resort ( room was not clean). We didn't expect this, because but it was nice.  Overall great ambience, good and interesting experience

KKI5aQ8ssM9RpZ65w6NYRQ.text: Great experience! Excellent service! Mouthwatering delicious food! I was yelping different restaurants in the MGM to see which one was appealing. It was either Iron Chef Morimoto, Emeril...BAM, or Celebrity Chef Wolfgang. I am very happy that I chose Morimoto. Our server Prince was a delight. He gave his favorite recommendations and also helped us pick out a wine to match our food. Sushi chef Xu presented multiple sushi dishes to our table and they are works of art....not to mention lip smacking good! If I could rate 10 stars, they would get 11! Sashimi plate: fresh high quality Oyster with uni/foie gras: melts in your mouth (it can use less sauce in my opinioin) Whitefish carpaccio: packed with flavor and comes with a salad. Toro Tartare: bomb.com (Chef Xu even gave us a tutorial on how to eat) And to end the dinner with this chocolate dessert creation. Watch the video. This is a place to go if you want to impress your date or just go for good quality food.

yWeTyOL7EBMLFmKS_9KRAg.text: I've alyways been a fan of Morimoto doing his thing on Iron chef and all. This restaurant took a heck of a while to open but it seems all worth while.   Decor and ambiance is the standard casino style. They all have this odd sleek, modern minimalist, steel gray, with super low lighting, blend into the background look to them that I guess plays to being a upscale romantic destination...however very generic imo.   Into the food and service! The menu is expansive as well as expensive. Some things made sense price point wise, like the 57oz (give or take an ounce) tomahawk steak for 170 but other things kept you scratching your head why. Ordered a variety of a la carte sushi and sashimi along with an eel avocado roll and the soft shell crab roll. Sushi and sashimi were all super fresh and well crafted. The rolls were a bit too loosely rolled but flavor components were spot on.   We shared the 16 oz snake farm Rib eye steak and the 48 hour cured and brined double cut pork chop as well. Both cuts of meat were phenomenal and executed beautifully. Pork chop came with a bed of sauteed housemade kimchi and that was super delicious too. Ordered the spicy string beans as a side for more ruffage but sadly they were under seasoned lackluster. The chilled green tea soba noodles had a nice body and chewiness to them too.   Our server was really nice and attentive without being obtrusive and also treated us to a complimentary Japanese style cheesecake for dessert and it was a beautiful way to end the evening for sure! Not like your heavy sense NY style, which I adore, this is more liken to a souffle. Absolutely well done.   I'm completely spoiled living in NYC and having such access to incredible food however I'm happy to know solid places like these are around for me to enjoy in my travels!

5nexaHKuK01P5bwsILgaHw.text: In a recent trip to Vegas, my wife and I like decided to dine at a fancy restaurant. We settled on Morimoto's which is located inside MGM. We made reservations ahead of time online on their website, which saved so much time and hassle of trying to get wait and get a table. The hostesses were very nice. When seated our server was also very welcoming and explained to us the dining experience and also went through each page of the menu with us along with their personal recommendations. We ordered a few things and mostly of entrees are pretty much shareable. The ambience of the restaurant is very laid back and the decor was very nice. This restaurant is "$$$" for a reason, but it is the real deal and totally worth the experience.   Our ordered consisted: Sticky Ribs, Surf and Turf, Chef's Combination Sashimi and for dessert the Fiery Chocolate Tart! All were top notch choices! My personal favorite were the sticky ribs, so much flavor in each bite and very tender! The bill came out to be $200+ for us both but the experience paired with the fact we only fine dine once in a while it was well worth the price. Morimoto's, thank you for the great experience!

9G4Fx4k5RrNmxPSdvECUMQ.text: Never fails to deliver. The food always tickles the taste buds. We ordered chefs choice. As always it was fresh and creative. I have been to Morimoto in Philly and NYC. Las Vegas just as good. So glad I went, would go back again.

m5gG9UyNBi4wFpjXp63mow.text: I was super excited to hear famous chef Morimoto was coming to Vegas and even more excited when I was finally able to try it. First impression, loved the design and ambiance set forth by the decor. I remembered when it was Shibuya and I loved how they opened it up and made it one grand restaurant. We were greeted by our hostess and seated right away. We had reservations and they were super busy so side note reservations would be smart especially on the weekends.  We were greeted by our busser who offered us still or sparkling water, then soon we were greeted by our server, Aries. Aries was wonderful. He was friendly, attentive, suggested some great dishes and recommended some very tasty cocktails.   The food was absolutely amazing. The presentation of each dish was even more astounding. We were all in awe of how each dish was explained, presented and best yet tasted!  Appetizers -Blistered shishito peppers -oysters -beef carpaccio -hamachi tacos  Entrees -new york strip steak that was served over a hot pan. The server poured a sauce over it which made it all sizzle.   -buri bop with yellowtail. It was mixed and made at our table in a hot stone pot. The runner described each step as he made it, which was quite cool to see.  - seared snapper with cocunut curry. This was by far my favorite dish, full of flavor. -Tuna pizza -an assortment of sushi -yellowtail Carpaccio definitely different than what I'm used to but in this case different was very good!  Desserts - doughnuts that are serves with vanilla whipped cream filled pipettes  - fiery saltey caramel chocolate tart, GET THIS!! The presentation alone is worth it!   Loved our dining experience here and definitely looking forward to our next visit

Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States

xMFIjvM8xKpoDmCC0gyIhQ.text: If you want to splurge on a dinner, or impress your date, definitely come here.  If your expectation is you will see master chef Morimoto greeting guests you will be disappointed.    Overall though, we enjoyed our experience dining at Morimoto's.    We came during off peak, after new year's but made reservations anyway.  When we arrived, the place was half full so turns out didn't need formal reservations.  For some reason the hostess seated us at a small table right beside the entrance of the restaurant, we politely asked if we could sit inside and enjoy the ambiance of the place.  (not sure why she would do that considering it was half full)    In terms of the decor of the restaurant, it's definitely very pretty and as mentioned before if you want to impress your date this is a go to spot.    In terms of food and drink we tried the following: 2 cocktails, duck rice with egg, sushi combo, pork belly, black cod, and doughnuts and the chocolate fireball for dessert.    In terms of the menu, I believe its seasonal, so I'm sure some items you see on yelp you may not be able to get, but the core items are usually always there.    As for the food and drink: the cocktails we both got weren't anything special (both fruit flavored), next time I would probably pass and just get a beer or soda.  In terms of food, the one we liked the least was the pork belly (kakuni).  The pork belly was dry and bland, you will easily find better pork belly at a popular Chinese restaurant.    On the other hand the duck rice with egg, sushi combo, and black cod were all very good.  In terms of presentation and taste, one of the best I've tasted.  As for dessert, for me I actually liked eating the doughnuts better than the chocolate fireball.  The chocolate fireball of course looks great posting on yelp, but the actual taste is just ice cream and cake.  The doughnut is basically a play on a Chinese doughnut with cream filling.    Overall, for 2 people with drinks and 3 to 4 entrees, you're probably going to run around 150 to 200 easily.   If you're okay with spending that much I would definitely recommend Morimoto's next time you're in sin city.

1xVJgQDx4y1iemA2U4v1Vw.text: We have great service and a wonderful meal every time we eat here.   The waitstaff is always helpful and make great suggestions... which we always follow.

mk0Qp7Q2WgTSouMoScP9lQ.text: This location is very similar to the Napa restaurant. The opening chef came from the Napa location so you will find many similarities as Napa. With that said, it's just as good as Napa but it is a bit more expensive than the Napa location. A few dollars here and there between some dishes.   Toro Tartare - I love the presentation and it taste great but it's a bit difficult to eat. White fish carpaccio - The hot oil they drizzle on top cooks the fish just a bit. I eat sashimi but still prefer my fish cooked so this is perfect as you get the best of both worlds. Duck Duck Goose is fantastic, especially the fried rice. It's duck cooked four ways. The leg came a bit dry and our server Aries was awesome and offered to bring me another. The second one was perfect and delicious. Braised black cod - was flavorful and moist but I've had better just a few days ago at Nobu.   I asked for a virgin cocktail, they brought me a mango match punch (virgin) it was awesome. One of the best mocktails I've had.   I live in San Francisco and am driving distance to the Napa location but I still would come to this location when I'm in Vegas next time. Fantastic meal.

OuKOhUhWPQckw6ncKObxMQ.text: It may be very hard for me to give 4 or 5 stars to any restaurant in Las Vegas. They all just lack ambience wherever they make up for taste and flavor. The Sushi was not different from what Origami my favorite place sells for half the price. The entrees were tasty. Our server was weird. Kept looking at my friend while asking questions. These are the small nuances that makes one lose their appetite.  Anyway. They get 7 for taste, 4 for service, 6 for flavor, and a 2 for ambience.

LCvZLtLoTZpmJs2BE5SyGg.text: Wow..just wow! I came here for a celebration dinner with 9 of my family. I made sure to book the reservation far in advance since we had such a large party...so if you do as well I'd recommend it.   We sat down and were greeted by a very nice serving staff..she explained that the best way to eat here is family style so that is what we did.   Ordered drinks, highlighted by the Japanese Mule! Very good but very gingery!   We ordered soo much food..pork gyoza, white fish carpaccio, wagyu beef carpaccio, sticky ribs, hamachi tacos for the appetizers! Sashimi, a couple sushi rolls, ribeye steak, black cod, and duck fried rice for the main round! Followed by 2 fiery chocolate tarts and 1 doughnut for desert. It was A LOT of food for us but we finished everything except some of the steak which we took home. Everything we ate was absolutely incredible and the fish was some of the best I've ever tasted!   If you have the money and want some amazing Japanese cuisine..this is a must go! 5 star dining from start to finish!

photos.caption: Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Ribeye
Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Doughnut (we thought it was going to be one doughnut...boy were we wrong)
Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fiery chocolate tart (must order!!)

tnKl0eGTlUV3JFqq5sZeYw.text: ok ok ok....this place is gonna get it right now...  we strolled over to Morimoto tonight to check out the spot. I have been walking by this place a lot going to Craftsteak (which we love). I just keep saying "we should go there and check it out and get some sushi" and never really acted on that until tonight.  so we get over to Morimoto, check out the menu and at first was a little put off by the prices, but hey lets try it out right? So we get in, get sat down and start to try and decide what to get.   Now usually I would just get a rib eye steak and call it a day, but i wanted to try some things, while looking through the menu I started to realize that this is going to get close to $500 and up for what I wanted to order. How is that possible? Let me dive in.  First, the steaks are like $100 for a "16oz" rib eye. They have the Wagyu meat also like everyone else, but they are charging a GRIP for their food. EVERYTHING is priced to the max, 20,000% markup. So before this started to go down, I eye balled the starters and wanted to try the tuna tacos ($21). There is a photo on here that shows them, so i went with that first. Then we also ordered the rock shrimp dish ($24). We waited and talked about the menu with the waiter and he said "the sashimi was 1 slice of fish per order"...this is where I checked out. You SERIOUSLY went there. 1 slice that is no longer then a inch maybe 1.5 inches and a qtr inch thick is ranging up to $20 or something? you tripping Morimoto or whoever setting them prices!   So on to the dishes we did order. The rock shrimp came first. It was good in flavor but like...it just reminded me of deep fried, thick battered shrimp you can find at sizzler. Nothing special AT all. The shrimp size was very small, petite at best and maybe less then 1lb of it in the dish. whatever, ate that.  the next dish i ordered were those tuna tacos (based on the photo i saw here which is ULTRA misleading). When I got them and the runner slid them my way, i instantly laughed. The SIZE of the taco was very small portioned. Like, you know how you get a standard street taco and the tortilla is about 5 inches round? This is like 3-3.5 inches round. Folded in half, crunchy. Now the flavor was very good, no doubt about it, but again the portion was ridiculous.  After the tacos were swallowed the waiter was talking with us about other options and we weren't having it. He showed me the meat display which was nice, but still not getting me to come close to order it for the prices they are asking. Then the couple behind us had their food delivered and he told me that was the meat dish, and whatever side dish they ordered and the only thing we can think of and said outloud was "where is the meat"? well the guy behind us ordered the 3oz minimum steak I think, i dont know. I got up and looked and there was like 4 slices of meat on his metal dish. And the waiter chatted up the dish is 400 or 450 degrees and you pour the sauce on and it sizzles and cooks a little bit more into the meat or whatever. man no thanks. I'mnot having it.  just asked for the check and left. was going to go over to craftsteak (which is so delicious) but wanted something new so we tried the new Italian spot across from Morimoto and was happy there. portions were good, price was fine (high but not even close to the prices Morimoto is asking) and ill review them later on, i just had to get this off my chest.  so that is why this is getting 1 star. The food quality is eh, ok. The taste is whatever. the water was good, ill give them that. that water filter is superb. Very clear and good tasting. However, there is just no way it is reasonable in the slightest to put these prices on the menu. Yea they are getting it, and maybe the people eating there just have so much money they dont care, or they won some hands at the blackjack table or a few pots on the slot machine. whatever the case may be, just because your in Vegas doesn't mean you have to price gauge your patrons. But again, if there are people out there willing to pay these prices then by all means keep ripping. But not going to get that from me (even if its free).  Rib Eye steak for $98-$100? And right next door the same steak with a delicious flavor for half that price almost, well that is where i will go! And the Italian spot across the way Rib Eye was like $50 or $60 and was EXCELLENT.  If the starting dishes we got were great we might have went further but I just wasn't feeling it.

Hz5ZzT164fmzaem9jKkTjQ.text: Overpriced and under inspired.  Ive been to Morimotos in philly a number of times.   This LAS experience left me sad.  I've travelled a bunch and sushi is my global favorite, especially classical fish.  I sat at sushi bar, was not allowed to interact with chiefs.  Had to order all thru waiter.   Asked for some type of OMAKASE, was told to order $50 chef selection.  I got talked out of trying to order my own.  I was not able to find out what beautiful fish was recommended or find out what the chiefs liked.  What I got was what you could get anywhere for $25.  The roll was a simple chopped tuna with mayo.  Seriously this upset me more than anything.  Here I am at a high end restaurant and I get a chopped tuna roll with mayo?.!?!  Only got some of the basic and simple fish selections.  Heck I Did not get some of the great taco, octopus that was in the case in front of me.   Miso soup was good but for one person and only one drink I walked out of there for over $100  And really was sad  I had a better time and food at the sushi rotation convoying joint over in the Chinese areas two nights ago.  Now I did see others with wonderful looking meals.   Thus IMHO go there for Japanese fusion but stay away from their sushi.  Yet if in Philly be sure to hit them uo

8rYou5MU88o5rf-YbnpUtw.text: 3 stars for food (adjusted for the cost) and 5 stars for service.  Honestly it's a good restaurant with great service. We came here for team dinner and ordered 1 sashimi and 1 sushi boats (about 150 each) and several appetizers.  The fish was great, they were fresh and of very high quality. Most melted in the mouth with great texture. However it wasn't too much better than other expensive sushi places (that are cheaper).   The fried rice was great, tempura was average. The deserts were phenomenal though, the icecream in a chocolate ball had great presentation and taste.

JsOQcRa2uL3m9kUQOSW8Qg.text: TL;DR: Food was fabulous, service could use improvement. I had the spicy tuna tacos and chef's choice sashimi. Look at those pics without drooling - I dare ya.   I also had a cucumber cocktail but it was sickeningly sweet. Maybe opt for a glass of wine.   Finally, service was not attentive at the sushi bar. It was difficult to get my water refilled. Soy sauce was not in reach. They didn't check in much and it took a while to get my check, etc. I also noted there were like 7 sushi chefs standing and watching the crowd but not really engaging at all with the sushi bar customers despite having long periods of downtime in their work. Maybe that's a cultural thing or a fancy restaurant thing? I'm used to having more basic interaction even from busy sushi chefs (e.g eye contact, hello, how is your meal). Food for thought for management :)

L8KyVu2Cfpxe4Zkd-vb2hg.text: Had a reservation for me and my husband's anniversary this past Saturday. Food was amazing but service could've been better. Our server, I think his name was Matthew (according to our receipt), was nice but seemed a little robotic and not personable, and our water was never refilled until we got our check. We had empty cups for a long time. But onto the food.  -Toro tartare: delicious and fresh! It was fun scooping up the toro and trying the different toppings.  -wagyu beef carpaccio: the best dish of the night! We really wanted to order more of this. It's so delicious l, you must get this.  -surf & turf: steak cooked perfectly medium rare with broccolini, onion, and mushroom. Hamachi was fresh and came with a little squeeze dropper you can use to add some chili oil.  -braised black cod: melts in your mouth and sauce was delicious! It's good to note that it's just the fish by itself so I'd order something to go along with it. Which is why we ordered duck fried rice.  -duck fried rice: yummy fried rice with a fried egg on top. Yolk was runny, just the way we like it!  Overall, we enjoyed our dinner and would like to come back again to try other dishes the next time we are in town.

YGcZVLeD64iteDifEXKAJA.text: The menu is pretty limited, and anything custom that you ordered they won't make for you. However the fish quality was outstanding, as was the cooked seafood pot!  As with anything in Las Vegas it is going to be expensive. You should come here with a fat wallet and a set my empty stomach but what you will eat will be fantastic!   You must get their homemade donuts for dessert. The little yellow balls that you see on top of these round cinnamon delicious pieces of flour are actually filled with cream custard. You squeeze them into the cinnamon deliciousness to make them an amazing dessert!!  I went here for dinner with four Co workers. Two of them had two drinks and two of us had none. Our bill was $480. This is not your average sushi place with average price remember you are in Las Vegas!  All in all it was a great experience but there has to be more reasonable sushi restaurants in Las Vegas with equal or better fish quality. You're paying for the name!

jHFJlDS2Anzc8rLhKBILPw.text: HOLY FREAKING MEAL!  I love you, Chef Morimoto. Will you marry me and cook for me every single day of my life until I become obese?   Perfection.  Tuna tacos: YES Tuna roll: YES Tuna tartare: YES. our favorite dish of the night among many, many wonderful dishes. Rock shrimp tempura, two ways: YES and YES A5 Waygu: OMG YES Yellowtail with rice: probably the only miss of the night. Didn't love it.  Blueberry panna cotta: This started me on my obsessive panna cotta adventure for the next 5 days in Vegas, whereon I hunted down panna cotta everywhere like some insane panna cotta stalker.   Eat here.

F33aQxUfGCI6aLzhmEZiXQ.text: Went for dinner on monday night. Not too busy.  Ordered japanese whiskey and wagyu beef appetizers. They both were good.  For my main dish i ordered Chirashi bowl. This was a bad idea.  Most of the fish tastes like old and leftover pieces from other dishes. Alot of them are fishy beyond normal taste.  I had to cover it up with alot of wasabi and soy.  Overall it was pretty good experience.  Overpriced ofcourse to be expected, however highest quality also to be expected. Sadly that was not the case for me.  Stay away from the chirashi bowl. Not fresh at all.

kurC0R6D9JWBVVM4VpuTAw.text: Morimoto has to be one of the best sushi restaurants in Vegas. This is a classy, fine-dining experience that not only serves superior and quality seafood but also offers an awesome experience while dining in by having great servers and fast service.   My BF and I didn't have a reservation when we arrived but we were seated immediately upon arrival at the sushi bar as they had just opened for dinner. The restaurant filled up quickly shortly after. It was quite the entertainment watching the skilled sushi-chefs prepare not only our dinner but everyone else's. The food here is treated like an art and I appreciate their attention to detail as their food not only looks amazing but also tastes phenomenal.   I will without question, be back to Morimoto and would recommend all sushi lovers to check it out as they will not regret it. But definitely make a reservation as this is a popular restaurant.

pyVMBWQ_4xrN-npiyKSs0A.text: Party of 10. So we tried a lot and it was amazing.  The favorite of almost everyone was the whitefish carpaccio salad.  Unbelievable.  Sushi was super fresh.  One tip, we ordered family style and the recommended portions were too much.  We could of cut back on number of orders. Thankfully we had 20yr old men with us that found a way to keep eating.   Dessert... flaming chocolate ball was very cool. This is a very pricey meal so be ready for sticker shock. But its Vegas... go big or go home.

photos.caption: Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Flaming chocolate

XBX7HVODZjrpQrDBAFsWTg.text: This place was a dream of flavors. I feel like we ordered the whole menu and nothing was disappointing.  The tuna pizza kicked off the night just right, followed by the rock shrimp. Both were delicious. The rock shrimp had a wasabi breading that set it apart from other tempura shrimp. The pizza had a nice kick and had more tuna than I expected. Other places tend to cut the tuna very thin, but morimoto didn't skimp on the tuna and made me feel like I was eating my money's worth. The raw oyster dish was a treat. It included crab and lobster presented on a beautiful display. Drinks: the "geisha" was a masterpiece. Dessert: the panna cotta was creamy and simply delicious. Not too sweet, nor too bland.

wplZLzjq5_16M8k-QccTdg.text: Hands down, the best Japanese restaurant I have been to. The tuna tartar was a super unique dish and unlike anything I have ever had. The tartar itself was super fatty and melted in your mouth. I loved how it came with all the different sauces and toppings on the side so you could customize each bite.   My boyfriend and I also shared the sushi combo for two. It came with 2 sushi rolls and lots of nigiri. Usually I would prefer sashimi over nigiri because I'm not a huge fan of rice. But this rice was cooked perfectly and paired perfectly with the fresh fish. Definitely the best quality sushi I've ever had.

spcl6UI6XDvq0c2Pi8_aJg.text: Favorite restaurant in Vegas to date.  The hype is real and even though I never watched Iron Chef I believe there is some True culinary skill behind the food at Morimoto (not to mention the super fresh sushi)!  We ordered the omakase for our first night here and were so impressed we came back the night after for the A5 Japanese Waygu + 17 year old Nikka whiskey, followed by the 30 year old sake for dessert. DE-LI-CIOUS. Super pricey but actually worth the money we forked over!  I will 100% be back again to Morimoto.

gdW5YRQacYcgXH_PkIDAww.text: My first time to the Vegas location, but I've been to the Napa many times. Napa location is amazing so didn't now what to expect at Vegas. Restaurant is located inside MGM hotel towards the back. The restaurant is super modern and sophisticated. I love the decor and the huge sushi bar area. The staffs were welcoming and very friendly! We arrive 20 mins late to dinner due to Vegas traffic, but hostess quickly checked us in and sat us down. The place was pretty pack and it was a good mix of different people. Our waiter was beyond awesome! He helped us with the menu and explained to us the chef's special.   Food was so bomb!!! As bomb as Napa location! We order sushi rolls, black cod, crispy fish, laksa noodle, oyster foie gras, rice bowl bimbibop version. Hands down the best dish here is the black cod! It is always delicious no matter which location. It's the MUST order dish when eating at Morimoto!!! It's well seasoned and extremely buttery....I mean melt in your mouth buttery with eyes roll back and everything. Lol My second favorite is the crispy whole fish. The batter the fish is fried in is light, crispy, and perfectly seasoned. The fish itself is super fresh with no fishy smell and just delicious....makes me drool just thinking about it! The sweet/sour papaya salad accompanying the crispy fish adds the perfect balance of flavor! The flavors works so well together. The rice dish came raw in a very hot stone pot which they cook the fish, egg, and rice right in front of you. What an awesome show! The sizzling of the fish definitely adds to the effect. Rice and fish was cooked perfectly. Although it was good it didn't come close to being compared to the two fish we had. The fishes were the show stopper. Oh, and if you are craving for some noodle soup just do yourself a favor and order the laksa noodle! So satisfying!!! It has a very rich umami broth! The noodles were cooked al dente and had the perfect chew. I can definitely eat a huge bowl all by myself. The cooked oysters are great! I'm not a huge oyster fan, but since it's cooked and topped with foie gras believe me you'll never know you're actually eating oysters. Each dish ordered was just as perfect as the last. It didn't matter which location the food and service stayed consistent at both places. If I ever do win big  in sin city this has to be one of the place I'll be ordering everything on the menu!

QzU8-vY0oaAqLqEMmYcfuw.text: At first, there were no server for our table and I was disappointed about it. However, a manager-liked staff realized and came to us immediately to compensate the awkward situation.  8oz filet absolutely ruled. It was very juicy and soft. They provided us with a special sauce and the steak was already cut.  Oyster foie gras is a creative course. If you are a "must try" person, try this one.  I'm not a dessert fan, but Pana cotta won my favor. The not-too-sweet base dessert came with sour and extremely sweet chocolate sorbets on the side.

ReKQNQbMQn4s7KWWk1Vd0g.text: The sushi here was simply amazing and fresh.  We had a party of 8 for a birthday dinner here with tons of fresh cut rolls and saki.  We tried everything from spicy tuna rolls to specialty rolls.  The rolls had fresh full pieces of meat.  It was perfect.   The service here was very attentive and friendly.  The atmosphere here is contemporary chic with modern Asian flare. We loved it.  It wasn't too loud but also wasn't as quiet as a library.    The sushi chefs were very friendly and very knowledgeable about their craft.  It can get a bit pricy but overall It was a great dinner for all of us.

k8IkEf6ROGX4P4n7BD_Gow.text: Located in the MGM- we went last night before we went to a cirque show. Very hospitable and friendly. They even brought us out a complimentary dessert for us being newlyweds.  It was the first time I've had sea urchin caviar from the Santa Barbara cost, very good.  We then each had the pork bowl- they bring it out in this iron cast skillet and cooks in front of you.  Perfect meal before a fun evening out.

AYcCWYjMAtZrToID7ND_PQ.text: Food was amazing! Loved the desserts! Great ambiance, the service was great, our waiter was really friendly, attentive and very knowledgeable. Will definitely be back

BTpWYQh3d5pU9Yj1-iL9gQ.text: This is beautiful, quality food. The service was great. What keeps me at 4 stars was being tucked in a kind of lame corner at the back.

QI6c_FWMC2w4GX2O3RRtBQ.text: I came here after the boxing match at MGM on 6/9.  I had heard so many good things about this place my friend and I decided to see if we could check it out.  Lucky for us we were able to get a table at the lounge on a busy night.  Steve who was the bartender that night gave us great suggestions on some appetizers and sake we might enjoy.  We ended up having the sticky ribs and the buribop.  Also we got a blue bottle of sake (can't remember the name).  The food was delicious!  The sake hit the spot too.  The staff gave a thorough explanation and history of all the food and drinks that we ordered.  Later on we ordered some sushi which included mackerel and tuna. Some of the freshest fish I have ate here in Vegas.  We were visited by two different managers during our time.  Overall I was very impressed with the food and service.  I'll definitely be back in the future for a more planned out and formal dinner.

yLDxVMz5NNHDdEVq3gc0ww.text: We have been going to this restaurant for a few years and time after time it is exceptional service, very good food, and ambience that makes it worth going out.

GSR4wRKxRkSKKoYUbN8fyA.text: Wanted to give 3 1/2 stars but that's not an option lol. Appetizers and entrees were great. Sushi and rolls were nothing special. Fish quality was just ok!

8OR3JAl_gwCbJqQslHd7vQ.text: Absolutely fantastic. It was our first visit and our server made some great recommendations. Highly recommend the Devils Advocate as a cocktail. The ribeye was awesome and the sushi was incredible. Don't miss out on the sticky ribs and the duck confeit fried rice.

photos.caption: Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Tuna carpaccio - amazing flavor and was incredibly tender

8mcyQzAdRCfiJmTxHiE8Dw.text: Went here on October 24, 3 days after their grand opening.  The service and the food was great.  I went with a party of four and we let the waiter tailor our meal for us spending about $200 before tax and tip. The best part of our meal, food wise was the sashimi with a close second being an oyster dish.  I know a yelp review is more helpful if you actually include the names of the dishes but we ate so much and my memory is not all that good especially after a few beers.  Our server Ed was friendly and made very good food selections.  The flaming chocolate dessert was excellent.  About an hour into our three hour dinner Ed pointed out that Chef Morimoto was in the restaurant that evening.  This made my wife very happy.  After multiple attempts she succeeded in getting us a group picture with Chef Morimoto. That was the highlight of our visit to this wonderful restaurant.

Mb0c2ow3_OFP3ZPVu4R-aQ.text: The food was delicious. The fish was very fresh and every piece tasted great. The service was also very good.

X-oTE_pQkoy5WkR8uOswfg.text: This was definitely one of the best meals of my life! Started with sushi and it was perfect. Fresh and sumptuous and it has ruined all other sushi for me. I had the duck duck goose as my entree and it was so good! The duck leg was juicy and tender, definitely my favorite part of the entree. For dessert, I had the coconut mango. The charcoal meringue was the highlight of this dish for me, so sweet and airy yet earthy.

5WSuwf9StD4lovOABkHBbg.text: This was a very solid restaurant.  The steaks were fabulous and really made this place standout.  The sushi was good but not spectacular.  Being from LA, I've had a lot of good sushi and it just wasn't at the top level.  The sides were good but again did not standout.  Come here for the steaks.  They are so much better than Craftsteak.

D1ZzsBO5lE8kOgmItX2-GQ.text: Sub par food.   Fish didn't taste fresh.   Manager never came when I requested.    Everything the waiter was doing was an upsell.   Very disappointing experience.   Morimoto I expected more from this experience.  Overall let down. For same price Nobu zuma and Tao crush them

8-132tzzTa4GxCGRZtYOLQ.text: A wonderful place, best sushi this sushi freak has ever had. I started with the teriyaki oysters foie gras and uni. All the different flavors were overwhelmed by the teriyaki so that that's all I could taste. A bit of disappointment there. I moved on to the Sushi 100, oh my! So good! You'd better be hungry. Service and Sake were outstanding.

UKvUmrAKgP78Oq8r3GUmRw.text: Went here on Oct. 25, 2016, for a family member's surprise birthday. Booked the reservatiins and was very impressed. Lisa took great care of us and Chef Morimoto helped to make this a very special birthday for our birthday boy! We loved the dishes and the great waitstaff. Next to the Honolulu location for my birthday, this one is another favorite of ours!  Thank you all for making this a great and very memorable dining experience!

SQD3nX2NLaD7t4YPv6XMqA.text: I was at Morimoto last night Jeffrey was my server the service was excellent we started with the tuna pizza  beef carpaccio octopus carpaccio for our appetizers for entree we share the surf and turf which was delicious we also had the crispy whole fish bronzino the service provided by Jeffrey and ruben runner was excellent we finish up with the fiery chocolate tart and the chill cheesecakes souffle the night was perfect thanks for the great service

65l-2BzhPs5sfY064JTpRA.text: I was so giddy as we walked up to the restaurant. Morimoto is my favorite Iron Chef... who am I kidding, he is EVERYONE'S favorite. My husband and I made a reservation and were seated immediately upon arrival. The decor in this place is cool and modern. Our waiter was extremely helpful in recommending dishes, and we basically went with whatever he recommended. I'd venture to say he is one of the best waiters I have ever had! We have a pork belly that blew our minds. Actual words spoken as I ate the pork belly: "I would want this to be my last meal whenever I die." Yup, that good. We also had a lovely seafood platter with all kinds of good stuff. Dessert topped off our great meal with a flaming chocolate sphere! Woo! I want to come back to this place as soon as possible! Loved it so much.

eqzZnN6JFf931IvzKU83mQ.text: Was pleasantly surprised at Morimoto by both the cuisine and the management.    We had three starters:   1)Tuna Pizza  - A must have, thin crust with tuna and toppings.  Expected it to be spicier with the halepenos but it was well balanced and sung in your mouth. 2) Sticky Ribs, another must have, fall off the bone, sweet glaze plays on your tongue.  3) Hamachi Tacos, good but not a standout, go with the first two.  Three mains: 1) Seared Snapper - Excellent, creamy smooth curry with bananas and rice.  Fish expertly done and all the flavours worked amazingly. 2)Duck Duck Goose -  More like 4 duck dishes,  1 Duck Fried Rice (what you would expect), 2 duck meatball soup - Just ok  3 Confit duck leg - Very good but again typical, and  4 Duck Breast (perfectly done, with a sweet savory gooseberry sauce, the best of the Duck dishes)  They should make the breast a dish by itself and throw in some fois gras. 3) Pork ishi Yaki Bop -  This was a let down for us.  The pork was mainly the fat of the belly so its consistancy was very soft lacking pork flavour. Presentation was neat but the wow factor stopped there.   Dessert:   1)Fiery Salty Caramel Chocolate Tarte -  Dinner then a show, what else can you ask for ?  Melted beautifully.  The marshmallow inside was smooth and creamy not sticky at all.  Enough for two people.  Management: The manager Jim went out of his way to insure our experience at Morimoto ended on a positive note.  He took notice that we did not enjoy the Ishi Bop so he promptly made things right by exceeding our expectations.  He showed great awareness of his diners and their experience.  Because of Jim we left on a high note and will be sure to return.    Overall:  Great management, great food, good portion size, and a nice ambiance.  Morimoto is a must visit.  A+

N6fujUvMCDYLhlAEMcP_sg.text: Huge fan of Morimoto, loved our experiences in Philly and NY, Las Vegas not as much. The Vegas restaurant is very large, too large to maintain high standards? Food was solidly good, but not amazing or especially memorable. After talking him up to friends and booking the restaurant for a 50th birthday, we collectively agreed it wasn't worthy of the celebration.

o5QBQJVZMUwkzIlu9ICq0g.text: The Omakase set course dinner was fantastic.   Of course it was spendy but so was everything at the MGM and even most things we encountered in Vegas.  Two of us each ordered the Omakase and it was six courses of beautifully prepared deliciousness.  We shared one sake paring which really complimented the meal.  Kanpai.  Attentive and knowledgeable service. Nice decor.

_japUzn_s236I55rJtEaNQ.text: The food are so yummy ~~~but "laksa soup" with noodle is so bad for me!  The server are good ,the name is Truman  just like a gentleman ,and perfect! Nice  time to order steak in Morimoto too expensive !Have a fabulous night!

hSTQZ_P1473iNCpJ0LtlNA.text: Food was excellent!! Service was excellent!! Everything you expect from Chef Morimoto! Order the Fiery Chocolate Caramel dessert and the Oyster foie gras!!

zoFHLz3HOO2OLWn5XE2mEQ.text: All I can say is WOW.  The warm oyster, foie gras and teriyaki sauce is truly indescribable. The sushi, I do not think there can be any better. I know I have not found one yet. Right down to the pickled ginger and wasabi was perfect. Now to just learn how to use chop sticks. I tried Koshu. Very interesting and good. Excellent with my meal. Just waiting for desert. The chilled souffle with berries, sorbets and strawberry red wine sauce was great. My server, Eric, is the best and did not steered me wrong in helping me make my choices. Without a doubt the best meal I have had in Vegas so far. I will be back for sure.

OBlAl4R9CkmibhXpwmpFGw.text: Morimoto was a great experience! Had dinner with a couple of my girlfriends and all I can say is WOW. All wait staff was amazing, the GM even came to the table to make sure my girlfriends and I were taken care of and were enjoying our delicious dinner. I'd give more stars if I could!

my2lsFqWCtD1MVmqh8m-DA.text: Very, very, very much recommend. Had a very helpful server. He suggested a sushi platter based on what we were in the mood to eat. Very good mix. Also had the spicy green beans and spicy tuna tacos!!! Then we enjoyed Morimoto's signature dessert! Fiery Chocolate. So good if you like chocolate.

9e4igbLbeIflQ8LCuaWrcA.text: Morimoto's doesn't live up to the hype - don't get me wrong, it was delicious, but was a little underwhelming. The bright spots were his sashimi appetizer that came in small little stacks with different sauces - this is a must try. Also, miso soup, is miso soup - but at Morimoto's it was outstanding (please note that it is big enough for two people). The Miso Black Cod was good, and if you haven't had it before I would recommend, but Nobu still wins on the cod. The egg on the Duck fried rice, to die for, but the rice itself - long grain - was just so/so. MUST TRY the donuts!   The service was impeccable!  I do want to go back and try their tepanyaki though - the menu looked interesting.

wPbO0cUSDSzJaCBX79mz7g.text: Maybe our expectations were higher than they should have been  .. the Tuna pizza was tasty.  The large $200 chefs choice Sushi was presented well but for that much money it was lack luster at best. The sauce they put on the whole fried fish was disgusting! And trying to get a chicken dish for my mother-in-law with out being all curry sauced up proved to cause us to be served a mediocre chicken and potatoes dish. The medallion potatoes were dry and flavorless. We didn't eat them, nor did we eat much of the chicken. Oh and the specialty cocktail tasted horrible, we didn't drink it either.  For such an upscale restaurant you'd think they would notice what we didn't eat or drink... nope!

qOa2PcSXyF0jC3dndbe1Xw.text: The ribs were an excellent appetizer. They were cooked perfectly and fell right off the bone. Very tasty with a good combination of different flavors.   The two things I wouldn't wholeheartedly recommend would be the spicy green beans and angry chicken. They were on the salty side so not for everyone at the table but I still liked them. But the dishes others in my party ordered were admittedly better. Apple sauce pork, bimbambop with egg, duck fried rice with egg, and the oyster seafood dish.  For dessert, we had the fiery chocolate tart and cheesecake souffle with matcha green tea to drink. I'd recommend the chocolate tart over the souffle but I enjoyed both. The matcha tea was a great compliment.

Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mango drink
Photo of Morimoto - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Angry chicken, a bit salty. Rice straw stopping. Smaller green peppers very spicy but the big green and yellow peppers are perfectly edible.

hiqT2uTzDa5vEeFCPNJ04w.text: I had the opportunity to go dine at Morimoto this past weekend. He is one of my favorite Iron chefs and I still remember getting to dine at Nobu in New York City and he was the head chef at that time. The sushi was out of this world as were the hot plates. This is why I gave this restaurant four stars and not five. It was good, but it missed the greatness that this incredible iron chef is known for. We started by ordering the Wagyu beef carpaccio as an appetizer and it was delicious. We also ordered the Himezen sake, a mildly sweet sake, that was really good. We went on to sushi where we ordered the yellowtail and scallion roll, the Toro and scallion roll, and the shrimp tempura roll. I did ask that any spicy sauce be kept off of the shrimp tempura roll. The shrimp tempura roll was yummy but it was not phenomenal like other places on the strip and off the strip where I have had it at. The yellowtail scallion roll was delicious but I still have had better on the strip. The Toro and scallion roll was on the smaller side but incredibly good. For entrees, we ordered the black cod which was absolutely delicious and melted in your mouth. We also ordered the yellowtail with rice Korean like dish that comes in a very hot pot and it was good, but I was not blown away by it. We found the rice to be quite bland. For dessert, we shared a mango and coconut dessert that came with the mango mousse and coconut mousse with a green tea ice cream on top and was very good. The price for all of this was very reasonable and we were impressed by the fact that the prices were not exorbitant. They were not cheap but they were also reasonable. The restaurant itself is beautiful, open and modern, and the service is very friendly. I have had better sushi at other places, which surprises me. The hot plates had one major winner and one that was just OK.  As locals, we talked about the fact the parking for 2 1/2 hours of dining cost seven dollars, which for Las Vegas, is new and a lot. We questioned if it is worth paying this money again to come eat at this restaurant, and we all agreed that the answer was no, because there are places that are phenomenal on and off the strip that are equally, if not way better, with free parking. Overall though, the food here was very good.

BJwwhJ9YSqOlCXavT5TYHw.text: Morimoto you are amazing!! I loved your restaurant. We had the omakase and everything was to die for. Thank you for the phenomenal experience.

aoaFoR4wuIBoe_ayPrw2iw.text: This was the best meal we had all weekend. The oysters with foie gras shouldn't be missed. On top of the bottle of sake and seafood, I will dream about this meal.      Yum.

SAkE_FMgjqdCY0A-7S_Abg.text: This is our third visit to Morimoto. We were so happy with the dinners we'd eaten there previously. What happened to your restaurant, Morimoto-san? When we made our reservation (well in advance) the host asked if we were celebrating a special occasion. Yes! When a fine dining restaurant asks about a special occasion, that means that it is acknowledged in some way - complimentary drinks, a dessert, sometimes even a small gift. We chose a restaurant like Morimoto for a special occasion just for this reason. Guess what we got? Bupkis. The host said "Happy Birthday" as we checked in and that was it. No other acknowledgement or special service. Our advance reservation awarded us a table just a few feet away from the restroom entrance. We had a floor show all evening of people using the facilities, including one green-faced young woman running to the bathroom with her hand clapped over her mouth - sushi novice? We'll never know.  The food was a mixed bag. We started off with wonderful appetizers - the tuna pizza and the Omakase tuna tartare were both delicious. It went downhill from there, with overcooked lobster, less than fresh sushi, and worst off all, a dried up, large lump of fake wasabi that wasn't even blended properly. If they had given us the tiniest amount of freshly ground wasabi, what a difference that would have made! This faux wasabi lump was an insult to the meal and to us.  Our server was personable enough, but there was minimal service throughout the meal, definitely not what you'd expect from a $$$ restaurant. Our server did one check-back after the appetizers were served, and then he chatted us up a bit before bringing the check. Since there were no warm towels offered, we had to use our own hand wipes, and the wrappers were never cleared from the table. Once of the servers spilled a little tea on the table - that was never wiped up. So many details that make a huge difference in the dining experience.

8HGm3RIJDPtK3mTiC7fv6g.text: Dinner on a Tuesday, and was able to get an 8:15 reservation at 7:30. I think the crowds come and go here, which is nice, compared to some of the other hot spots in Vegas that seem to always be busy.  We got the surf and turf ($48) and the seafood toban yaki ($42). The surf and turf presentation was beautiful, but it could have been better. Steak was a bit cold. But the seafood toban yaki... so, so good. You get a lobster tail, claw, and another piece, clams, mussels, shrimp, scallop, and an assortment of vegetables. All this to say, they don't skimp for the price. In my opinion, though, you need a side of rice or it gets too salty. It's reminiscent of a cioppino, but with an Asian twist. Would come back for the toban yaki any day.   Reason for 4 stars is that they definitely need more servers. Either they're slow, or they're in charge of too many tables. Our server came around only once over the course of our meal, and we had to order part of our meal with a busser. Good experience overall!

Q4H1GIjapGvW_qrNYqSg1w.text: This is my third marimoto,  I just stopped by since I was staying at the MGM.  It just opened I even saw chef marimoto himself the first night.  The sushi is super fresh... who would have thought in the middle of the desert.  I tried this 5 different fish sushimi app with 5 different dipping sauces which was over priced and I didn't get it....the spicy yellowtail was amazing though....they charge 7 bucks for a bowl of rice wtf?

0x7mCH3Oo00arlBpqZP2pg.text: Celebrated my wife's B-Day last week at Morimoto's beautiful contemporary grill inside the MGM Grand. This was an absolute treat, and a wonderfully memorable evening! We loved this extraordinary WOW factor dinning experience from start to finish. The thoughtfully attentive and knowledgeable staff made us feel like family. Loved the insightful Saki Somm's recommendations, and feasting on the gifted Chefs delicious masterfully crafted offerings. I look forward to our return in the near future to explore more of what this fantastic restaurant has to offer.

6M9FebfZHaiHI-UG48sJNw.text: I had Omakase here. It is a lot of food! 6 courses for  $140. Not a bad deal for Morimoto. ToroTartare , wagyu carpacho, seafood and vegetables with cheese dip, 6 pieces of sushi, surf and turf, and chocolate dessert. Service was good.

S-gwACNqKH2Ccy_xvP9xrw.text: Came here on Monday night for 5:30pm reservation. The hostess greet us right away and wished my sister Happy Birthday since there is a note that we celebrate my sister birthday that night.  New restaurant inside MGM Grand, it used to be Shibuya. It has a nice remodeled, nice atmosphere and decor.  We got Chef's tasting menu, the Omakase for $140/person. It is 6 course menu. Started with Toro Tartar, second course was Wagyu beef carpaccio, third course was seafood fondue( fish balls, shrimp, muscle, vegi and home made soba) come with tomato and cheese sauce. Fourth course was sushi combo, fifth course was Surf and Turf( beef tenderloin and lobster tail), last course was chocolate fire ball.  Our favorite was the Toro tartare, the sushi combo was so fresh and delicious, the surf and turf was awesome as well. I'm not too crazy for the fondue or the dessert course. Not too impress on the beef carpaccio, saw a lot of oil on the plate since the beef had been seared with garlic oil.  It was a great experience and I will come back to try other dished on the menu.

ycw05evBkOUXYVEBBYWiPQ.text: I definitely love this place. Duck rice had such a unique fragrance and  the flame of the fiery chocolate tart was definitely good for ins lover lol. Sake was expensive but of high quality.

4YVnH5b1d7TTWJOFiCDpDw.text: Morimoto is an excellent venue! I dined there last night, and was accommodated quickly even without reservations. The staff was super friendly and the food was amazing. I can't say enough great things about this place. The manager, Sandra even stopped by and gave us great recommendations. Overall an amazing experience!

HqceevMheUoqL4uW5eAAwQ.text: We went here for my daughters birthday while in Vegas. Just a great place lots of interesting food and drink selections. Can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

yTh2dr4OD9YvxFQTUOeWcg.text: I am a loyal MGM customer and have been here twice and brought a party of 8 two nights ago. The sushi was very disappointing the cuts of fish were small and the rice seemed to be a bit over cooked.  Also, we had a large sashimi platter and many of the pieces were crunchy and almost frozen.  I hate to leave a negative review, but for the money there are better places in town.

8SY52nNXNDJQ8LnNLdR6Ug.text: For anyone seeking exquisite, high-end, yet fun Japanese food, you must go to Morimoto. The food is spectacular. My brother and I had the omakase and every serving was stellar. The beef carpaccio is a must, and the sushi is delicious. While you expect great food, the service is even more outstanding. Jim, the GM, runs a great operations. From the first hello with the hostesses to the serving staff, it was an A+ experience. Thank you, Monica and Jim.

Il0pO176Sl9qdPDIAZqUww.text: First time visit...very fresh sushimi and sticky ribs were great.  Our server Prince was very helpful on explaining the different dishes and making suggestions on what to order.

EGf1TtIUcYWAKjcmQ0JtnQ.text: Ok, I had very high expectations for this restaurant. We sat at the sushi bar and looked over the menu. For the whole time we sat there, the wait staff took our drink and kitchen orders in a very timely manner. However, the sushi chefs was another story. At no time did they bother to speak with us to greet us and ask what we would like. Big turn-off and buzz kill!  The nigiri sushi was well over priced as well. Ranging from $9 to 16 per order and that is for one piece not two.  A Rainbow Roll order will set you back a whopping $35.  I ordered the Black Cod entree from the menu and it was horrible. Black cod by itself is a  very flavorful fish. The kitchen managed to ruin this dish by completely smothering it with teriyaki sauce.  Other than that, the decor was beautiful!  I would not recommend this restaurant to any one at any level. There are so many other Japanese restaurants in Las Vegas that offer a much better dining experience.

nK40Cfw4G391ryngY9TJWw.text: Ordered the Omakase (Tasting course) which is a MUST!!! Everything was cooked or prepared to perfection and the staff was amazing. Our server Eric was very professional and explained the ins and outs of the menu/cocktail menu as if he created it himself. Our bus person Juan was very polite and quick with the removal of dishes and cleanup of the table. The sommelier Randi visited the table and very kindly allowed us to sample a few different kinds of sake while explaining the origin and brewing process. Lastly the two managers Sandra and Karen both stopped by the table to assure we had the perfect dining experience. I love giving credit where credit is due and 5 out of 5 would definitely recommend to family and friends!

ENKhpaSivknIUlRBZm8Ehw.text: Ridiculously good! Wagyu carpaccio, duck meatball soup, spicy tuna roll, bluefin tuna sushi, Chef Morimoto soba beer; it was all amazing! I can't wait to return. It's a beautiful restaurant, service was phenomenal and the food is superb.
